description:
This cafe totally destroys the exact combination of things that irk me about many SF cafes. 
You know, the ones that close at 5pm, overcharge for sub-par food and have 4 bar stools that you aggressively stranger-smile your way into when one opens up?

Another Cafe caters to those that like to stick around and enjoy good coffee, post up and work to great music, meet friends, and stay out a little later than San Francisco would like you to on a weekday. 

Fuck yeah.
author: Liz R.

description:
Great spot for a quick coffee or simple sandwich. Love coming here before heading up to the park. 

Dirty chai lattes are fantastic. The banana bread, caprese sandwich, and the vegetarian sandwich are really good. Recommend getting the veg on pita. 

Best part about this spot though are the people. Folks are always friendly and make you feel super welcome. Also, love that all their utensils are eco-friendly
author: Tanika T.

description:
Had a chai tea latte with soy milk from here and it was delectable! 

The two ladies taking orders were friendly and had a warm persona about them. 

Unfortunately, they don't have matcha, but if I come back  again I'll get a chai and maybe a gluten-free cookie to go with it.
author: Peds P.

description:
Good food , good coffee , good tea, good customer service , good everything !!! Hahhaha
I love another cafe, great place to get work done, you can sit downstairs or upstairs it's up to you. If you forget your headphones they always have good music.
author: Jon P.

description: Loved this place!  Needed to find motivation to get some work done and this was just the perfect place.  Ordered their dirty chai latte and it was delish.  10/10 would come back again :)
author: Jezhra S.

description: This Coffee Shop meets NobHill exactly. I searched some good cafe with wifi & charge, hit Another Cafe located in my local area. This cafe looks small from outside, but inside is too spacious that a plenty of nomad folks work with their pc. I ordered coffee and chocolate chip cookie tastes ancient and hand-made great. I decided to commute here every weekend, love NobHill.
author: Shun Y.

description: Another Cafe is like a neighbor. I live in the area and enjoy coming here quite often even for just a cup of coffee to go. The staff is super nice. The art is always pretty cool and the regularly change it out. They display local artists which is cool. I LOVE the crumb cake both the regular and the blueberry. The bombolini is also a super yummy treat - an Italian donut with a light dusting of sugar and filled with Nutella. I mean OMG! I've tried a bunch of their sandwiches. I've never left unhappy. I definitely recommend this spot whether you go in for a quick cup, hang there and write, or to meet a friend.
author: Danielle S.

description: I love how much space this place has...I sat on the second floor, which overlooks the first, and because there are fewer people moving around and about compared to the first floor, I was able to really focus and get some work done. They have reliable wifi and good drink/food options. If I ever come back to SF, I would definitely come back!
author: Shannon C.

description:
In search of a good study cafe in SF, I ended up here one weekday. I was drawn to the Yelp check-in offer of free chips or fruit with a sandwich purchase. This place is still a bit of a walk from the Powell Bart station, but it's definitely in a quieter area because of it. A lot of people here were studying when I came in, but not too much that the place was overly crowded. There were plenty of seats and outlets around, both upstairs and downstairs. The upstairs ceiling appeared very low, so I preferred the downstairs seating area.

I ordered an egg and cheese sandwich and got a free bag of chips with my sandwich. The sandwich was a bit on the dry side, maybe because it was an english muffin. Despite the average-tasting food, the wifi here is very reliable and they have a public restroom, which are the 2 most important study cafe qualities. I was upset that there was a power outtage a couple hours into my studying and all the lights went off. I was impressed by how the staff handled the situation very professionally without panicking and allowed everyone to continue working. This place is also open until 10pm, which is rare for an SF coffee shop. I would definitely recommend this place for people who want to buckle down and study for a long time because they have food and all the necessities for studying.
author: Catherine S.

description: This place is nice but at least a couple of its workers are bad. They are terse to the point of being rude, they don't smile, and on more than one occasion they had to be reminded what my order was. They are young and inexperienced. The owner or manager needs to emphasize to her workers the importance of customer service.
author: K B.

description: I live nearby and come to this cafe almost everyday. The staff is amazing and the coffee is excellent. The regular house coffee is brewed strong and tastes rich (not burnt or watery). All of the pastries are fresh and tasty as well!
author: Ryan C.

description:
Good vibes, good name, good wifi, and a lovely group of writers that meets on Thursday. This is my favorite neighborhood caf.w quiet, good music, plentiful tables. It captures the best of both worlds, too -- lots of natural light and space on the ground floor, the feeling of a secluded corner on the second floor.

I highly recommend it.
author: Jenny W.

description: Awesome cafe to do some work with two floors sitting and light music, Id definitely recommend this place!
author: Jay G.

description: Pretty good spot and coffee. It has a nice vibe and it's located in a beautiful neighborhood in SF. It's pretty quiet, however with the exception of making espresso shots in the background. Other than that, you could get a pretty decent amount of work done here. It has a second floor, which is my preference. Love this place and it's ambiance. Average/normal pricing, ~$5-6 on an iced latte w/ an extra espresso shot & almond milk.
author: Cecile ..

description:
Cool interior, ample seating, coffee/tea selections. I got a chai latte with oat milk, sadly couldn't modify the sweetness but that's how it usually is and cafes use a pre-mix. 
Didn't appreciate the attitude of the cashier serving me, who seemed disinterested the entire time, looked off into the distance multiple times as I spoke and answered my questions with some sass. Sounds like the typical "cool place annoying service" experience.
author: Andrea M.

description: I'm a regular here and enjoy the laid back atmosphere, coffee, and food. A recommendation I would make is for the side salad that comes with sandwiches. It is often drenched in oil and vinegar. Not only is it over dressed, but it makes the bottom of the sandwich soggy. I would recommend either putting the dressing in a little plastic cup on the side or putting a squeeze bottle for the customers to add themselves.
author: Annie L.

description:
I loved this place (notice the past tense) for the past few years and would frequently drop in several times a week for an almond milk latte.  That was until some time last year when they changed their almond milk from an unsweetened version to Califia barista blend that's overly sweet.  WHY?!  People can add sugar to their drinks if they desire it, but those of us that chose to not have sweetened coffee drinks cannot take it away! 

I know this is going to sound super pretentious, but until they offer an unsweetened plant based (non-soy) milk alternative, I will not return.
author: Tina A.

description:
The name adequately describes the place.  It's another cafe.  There are Starbuckses little cafe's like this all over San Francisco.  This is another one.  It's on a street corner in a residential area on Nob Hill.  It's the morning coffee for a lot of people.

This place evidently permits people to bring their pets.  When we walked in we saw a woman playing with her dog while she waited for her coffee.  I thought that was nice at first, but then I saw the hairball.  Surrender Dorothy.  It was on a chair.  Also male dogs like to pee everywhere.  I didn't see any urine puddles, and I'm sure people in this neighborhood are responsible pet owners, but I mean yikes!

And the prices are a little on the outrageous side considering the food.  The food is ok.  Maybe that's too strong of a word.  I had a bagel with cream cheese, and Precious had a coffee and a breakfast sandwich, and the bill was twenty bucks.  I know that's close to what you'd pay at Starbucks, but this ain't Starbucks.
author: Dave M.

description: I'm writing this review as I sit in Another Cafe.  The food is great, the coffee is great, AND the music is awesome (and not crazy loud).  The upstairs seating is cozy and perfect for working.
author: Sally L.

description:
Their lackluster chai tea latte and almond croissant is (over?)compensated by their friendly service, lots of table space (and 2 floors!), fast free wifi, great slower-beat R&B/hip hop playlist and cool (hipster) art on the walls.

Chai tea latte is obviously made from a syrup/concentrate bleh

Each layer of the almond croissant is not folded with love and butter so it's not as flaky and layerful/flavorful as it could be. Also too much powdered sugar on top - distracts from pastry

Would come here to do casual work as it seems like no one cares if you sit here all day and dont really spend money
author: Jeanie N.

description:
Cool place, great decor, chill music and vibe, shitty employee. Notice, I said employee, not employees. Every morning I come in for a cup of coffee, and the days this particular man is working, I immediately want to walk out. Totally uninviting, doesn't smile, not polite at all and just looks like he hates his job. 

I've been coming here regularly for a while and I think it's time to move on to, Another Cafe.
author: Dixiee N.

description:
This place is cozy & quaint.
The wrapped coffee cake by the cash wrap, is everything. 
The service is quick and nice and it always makes me happy when dogs and their humans roll in which happens quite frequently here.
author: Ella A.

description: Deliciousness!!! I stumbled (literally) across this gem on a day trip to the peninsula.  On a side note trying to save money by walking up California street was all bad!! While doubled over trying to catch my breath at California and Leavenworth I glanced to my left and found my this place.  I had the English muffin with egg cheese and sausage.   Sounds simple right? No. They take it to a whole 'nuther level.  Oversized English muffin with country scramble egg, cheddar cheese oozing off the egg and sausage big enough to get some in every bite.  The muffin was grilled I think because it was crispy and held the ingredients together well.  I had a white mocha - my regular drink at all coffee spots.  Again above average.  Just the right blend of frothy goodness and caffeine.
author: Nerissa R.

description:
This cafe was a great place to work at when I was in the area. I recommend working here as it's not as crowded and busy as other coffee shops tend to be (like Starbucks, Peets, etc.).
The noise level is very low and there was a decent amount of seating. I've worked in other cafes that are too loud from other patrons and the music playing. The music wasn't distracting here and neither were the customers.

The wifi is password protected. The password can be found near the counter. They have free water and glasses available a guests.

They have an upstairs that provides more privacy. I didn't venture up there but it looked like a good space to do work.
author: Sara B.

description: Another Cafe, another 5 stars. Good prices and solid food makes this a nice daily place to grab a coffee, tuna melt, breakfast sando, and a place to flip up the laptop. Really cool upstairs place as well and the music keeps it pumping in a way that you can still have a conversation. Nice corner spot.
author: John G.

description: Pretty artsy and SF vibe where the second floor ceiling is barely leaving space between your head. And Yes, GREAT BAGLES.
author: Amin B.

description: Getting better. The apathetic baristas are gone and much nicer, calmer, happy baristas have taken their place. Hopes are high for a pleasant customer experience...
author: Anne S.

description:
First time visitor at this neighborhood cafe which was long overdue since I live barely five minutes away by foot. Had the day off so came by early afternoon on a weekday. I found it to be a mixed bag. 

Pros: 
Plenty of outlets, perfect lighting (not too bright or dark), the pastry I had was very good and reasonably priced. Love the layout of this place!

Cons: 
Loud and annoying music: The music was consistently loud and distracting, which was surprising since I didn't notice complaints in the few reviews I read before visiting. I wasn't nuts about their choice of music but it would have been acceptable if someone hadn't turned the volume up so loud. I was on the upper level and could barely hear my own music in my headphones. I found that atrocious.

Wifi issues: When I got upstairs and all set up to work, I was prepared to use my private hotspot as I typically do but when I couldn't get enough speed to stream music and surf I asked someone nearby for Another Cafe's wifi password. Thought I was good to go when my cellphone quickly connected but was dismayed when I kept getting error messages for my Fire tablet and a small laptop. I tried everything but couldn't get them to connect. I noticed that my cell's 4g connection barely had two bars so I don't know if Another Cafe is in a dead zone or if I was sitting in one in the cafe. Finally, after several frustrating tries I gave up and went back to my private hotspot. I don't recall a coffee shop where I couldn't get hooked up with either their wifi or my own hotspot to work so if the poor quality is consistent that would be a dealbreaker.

Good/Neutral: I found the employees polite--neither rude nor overly friendly. They were very helpful when I was choosing my pastry. It appears they have regulars and give friendly shoutouts to them which is to be expected.

Summary: Maybe Another Cafe's cons were one-off quirks, I'd like to give them another chance. Maybe I'll sit on the first floor this time and see if the wifi is better--that is if their music doesn't blast me away.
author: Janie J.

description:
Atmosphere great, plenty of seating, cool artwork, the "hiring" ad on the register is funny

Had an iced chai and it wasn't that strong or sweet...it tasted more like milk over ice with a hint of chai

Sandwiches had too much mayo in them. I ordered a Turkey Pesto and couldn't really taste the pesto... My girlfriend took one bite of the caprese (I think that's how you spell it) and couldn't take another. It was loaded with mayo

The workers are really nice!

The end
author: Nick O.

description:
Excellent cafe to buckle-down and focus!

It's hard to find a good cafe around SF that meets all my expectations:
+ fast wifi 
+ spacious (there are two floors; the ceiling is low on the 2nd floor though)
+ well lit on the 1st floor 
+ standing desk available
+ clean and spacious bathroom
+ regular brew was a bit sour but was good for price.
author: Linda K.

description: Love this spot for a variety of reasons. It feels local. The employees actually know how to make espresso drinks. The food selections offer both breakfast and lunch options (and they source local baked goods). There's a TON of seating (including upstairs), solid WiFi (though it occasionally flakes, but you can also get a good xfinitywifi connection inside). It's quiet. Drawbacks: food is pricey (13$ for a sandwich and a little side salad), it gets really hot inside on warm days. Overall, this is a good choice for a quick bite/coffee or if you need a place to work for a few hours.
author: Nic F.

description: Friendly and down to earth staff, smooth lattes, and toasty bagels. I pop into this neighborhood cafe every so often and it's always been consistent with their food and service~ I really appreciate the chill vibe and non pretentious staff and customers that frequent this place. It's also work friendly with seating down (and up!) stairs and plenty of outlets~ so expect to see a lot of folks on their laptops.
author: Kimi L.

description: This is a great place to get some work done. Good internet, coffee, and plenty of seats.
author: Vinayak P.

description: In breaking news, they seem to have resolved the wifi issue, or at least it's hummed along reliably on my last 3-4 visits. A welcome development.
author: James D.

description: The staff is super friendly, the service is fast, and it's clean and quiet. Great place to get work done.
author: J N.

description: Wanted a cool place with room to get some work done. Inside has plenty of tables plus an upstairs are with fun art work that has areas to sit as well. Perfect find!
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: I come here a lot. At least twice a week if not more. Great food and coffee the staff is always very nice. But something happened that I thought was crap. It was busy and I am waiting in line. Someone comes in 2 people behind me and knows the employees. A regular that comes in or a friend I wouldn't no. But they started making her food before they made mine! They were two people behind me and she got her 2 bagels and coffee before I got my order. I don't care if you know them but when there is a line you wait your turn. We have all been waiting too. I was not the only one upset. The lady who was behind me was making comments to herself like I guess I'm not getting that bagel (bc their friend took the last of a everything bagel). That is one thing about having these young people work they have their friends come in and do what they want.
author: A Nicole M.

description:
I have to first say my almond milk cappuccino was very good. 

I also ordered a Cuban sandwich...Let's say this, just because you put pickles and used ham and Swiss doesn't make it a Cuban sandwich. People, my people take great pride in our food, though this sandwich was good 8/10 it wasn't a Cuban sandwich. The mayo they used was too much , drowning in dressing doesn't make it a better sandwich Cuban sandwiches need the following Cuban bread (or a French baguette), butter the inside on one side of the bread, use yellow mustard on the other, pulled pork cooked in Cuban mojo and it's juices, ham, Swiss cheese, dill pickles and then pressed on a flat press so the sandwich is warm/hot on the inside and a light crisp on the outside. 

So when you come here and order the sandwich just know it's a good sandwich (8/10), dressing heavy (use napkins), and that's it's not really a Cuban sandwich. 

The Cubana American from LA
author: Yvette M.

description: Good coffee, nice ambience and lots of study space! Can probably fit 40 people!
author: Alex S.

description: Great staff and welcoming environment! Recently an  SF commuter, I've tried many coffee places and none would satisfy my coffee fix. BUT, THIS PLACE DID! the coffee is amazing and the food is yummy!
author: Kat H.

description: Less than a block from my AirBnB I was able to enjoy a quick breakfast and decent chai. Convenient and affordable. The counter staff were very friendly and kind.
author: Brianne C.

description: 3 bucks for a stale bagel. Meh.... I just needed something super small and cheap... This was not a good option. I'm sure their food is good, but I came in late in the afternoon and the bagel wasn't fresh anymore. I might try to come back but it's hard for me to spend over 10 bucks for a mediocre sandwich.
author: Kat D.

description: Great sandwiches and drinks. Great seating for getting some work done either solo or with someone.
author: Ryan B.

description:
I thoroughly appreciate the overly apathetic name, "Another Cafe." Does it get more hipster than that? When it popped up in nearby search on Yelp I thought it was too good to be true. The atmosphere wasn't anything special so it truly "wasn't trying." Literally just another cafe. 

Most of my visits were at 6AM so it's hard to judge the place. The staff was as nice as anyone can be when they have to work that early. I felt bad for them but I made sure to tip decently so they didn't hate me. 

As for the goods, their coffee is solid. Considering I got it 5 times I'd say I liked it. I also dig their English Muffin egg sandwich. They make it fresh right there, cracked eggs and all. It comes toasted with the cheese melted to perfection..mmmmmmm. Tasted homemade! 

Thanks for the morning fuel!
author: Aaron B.

description:
Charming little place with a nice selection of pastries and coffee. What it lacks in enough staff to take care of the morning rush hour it makes up for in politeness and the great upstairs seating area. 

Serving Bicycle Coffee with it's rich and woodsy aromas, but a smooth range, makes for a great cup of latte or a foamy cappuccino. Remember to grab a scone while you're there.
author: Alex D.

description:
One of the few spacious cafes on a sunny weekend! Beware that it definitely gets hot upstairs as there's little ventilation!

Food: very strong cold brew!! ($3.5)
Ambiance: nice and quiet with good music selection! Great place to stop by with friends to get some work done
author: Taryn Q.

description: Great coffee, good food and awesome music! I love this coffee shop! I go there whenever I need to get work done, it's pretty quiet, especially upstairs. Also, their lattes are the best. Go check it out!
author: Sabrina B.

description:
My go-to study spot! Especially when I need to really buckle down and not get distracted. I always see people slaving away on their laptops here. There's a sea of outlets everywhere so that's always an added bonus. Get here before 11am on Sundays or else you might not find a spot! Their wifi is usually pretty good, but spotty at times. I would probably bring a book for if it goes out and I wouldn't risk taking a timed quiz or anything like that here.

As for the coffee itself, it's pretty subpar to other coffee shops in SF, but I don't care. I don't come here for good coffee. I come here to study. The paninis are pretty good too when you're craving a bite to eat. I recommend the turkey panini! Downside is that it gets pretty stuffy in here, so every time I stay for more than an hour, I usually come home smelling like burnt panini. Also, I don't dare try the pastries. I've seen a family of flies hovering all over the pastries before and the workers don't do a damn thing about it.

The cafe is super hipster with the unique murals everywhere. And they play pretty good music, but that depends on the barista working. I've heard a variety of music ranging from Schoolboy Q to Banks to Drake to Two Door Cinema Club. Not exactly appropriate study music at times, but like I said it's a hipster cafe located in nob hill. I can dig it.
author: Cheryl N.

description:
The person that said "Mediocre coffee but fantastic study atmosphere" below me pretty much said it all. The mezzanine is nice since you can distance yourself from conversations, unlike in other coffee shops. And wifi is pretty good. Music is good. If they offered paleo-friendly breakfast like scrambles I would give them 5 stars!

Update: They set out almond milk, so that helped make my coffee more drinkable (I usually take my coffee black).
author: Michelle C.

description:
Another Cafe is one of the best coffeeshops around. It's not the biggest space but it has two floors with tables and chairs (including standing tables!) and I can spend hours here switching around when I get bored of one specific study location. 

The coffee itself is pretty good. I love the iced coffee - one of the best I've had. The sandwiches are pretty good too, but not spectacular or unique - they usually put it on the same type of bread. My favorite is probably the turkey. The mozarella one can get a little soggy. 

Sometimes, though, the cafe does smell a bit! The bathroom is located on the first floor and scents can waft out from there...
author: Julianna K.

description:
another cafe is fun, chic and has many open tables! it's two floors (tho the top floor has low ceilings) with a good selection of coffees and drinks. and there is wifi!

this is a cafe i would highly recommend if you want to study w friends or by yourself, and need to get work done. i'll be back!!!!
author: Cathy Y.

description: Great place to do work or read a book. Sometimes it gets a little noisy, especially later in the evening but over all it's a decent place around this neighborhood. The coffee is pretty good and their chai latte's are my favorite. However, the sandwiches are over priced and not very good... don't get the cranberry turkey! Or the tuna melt. It's bad... :(
author: Phil H.

description:
Good coffee the stuff are doing a great job 

Very clean place in amazing neighborhood

Very clean restrooms 

Very good vibe :) 

Highly recommended
author: Aviad B.

description: We got an americano, white mocha, lox bagel and everything bagel with cream cheese. Everything was delicious. They were averaged priced- $24 for everything we got. The staff was okay, I felt a little rushed yet there wasn't a line.
author: Olivia T.

description: Great place to get work done! I wasn't getting eye'd at for being here too long (5 hours lol), which made me want to try stuff. Got a Veggie sandwich, coffee, and beer through my stay. Chill vibe and the music is on point. I'll definitely be back when i'm in the area.
author: Alvin M.

description: Horrible service.  Three people behind the counter all in there phones.  Had to ask for my order twice.  No apologies from the workers.  They just kept dancing, singing, talking about their recent break ups...etc.  Not worth it at all.
author: William O.

description: 1st time here and will definitely come back. Good mix of bagels, breakfast sandwiches, panini Ana salads, coffee and other drinks.
author: Monica V.

description: Their music is so loud sometimes you feel like you are in a night club. This place is hit or miss depending on who is working and what music they are playing. If you are trying to have a quiet lunch, or a conversation with a friend over coffee, or even to get some work done the music can be so irritating that it's pointless to even come here. I try to sit as far away from the music as possible - and even with my noise canceling earphones can still hear it and feel the vibrating base sometimes. Coffee is okay, food is good. But atmosphere very iffy-
author: Devon M.

description: Cool vibe and none of the pretension. It hits the sweet spot between a more corporate chain and trendy coffee house, something that used to be ubiquitous but now clearly warrants a shout out.
author: Sarah K.

description: Just moved into the the neighborhood and was craving something sweet.  Upon walking in, I stand right at the register waiting to be acknowledged and asked what I want to order.  However, the guy is very focused on his texting conversation instead.  He sees me, but just decided that his conversation is more important.  It's ok, I'll just stand here awkwardly waiting for service.  When he finally acknowledges me, he's not even friendly.  This is your customer facing representative?  If this were my business, I would fire him.  I could get better service at McDonalds.  Oh and their overpriced pastries are stale.  I could only eat half before throwing out the rest.
author: Jack T.

description: It's really close to my place and the turkey club is yummy as well as the lemonade they play music for everyone
author: Brooke W.

description: This is my favorite place in sf for breakfast and a coffee break! The food is unbelievable  and the costumer service is even better... they are always with a smile and willing to serve!! They also show artwork and the music is perfect if you are looking for a spot to relax and even work at..1000% recommended!!
author: Maria Y.

description:
Came here to get some studying done. I was really excited to come here from the Yelp photos. Kinda disappointed from the visit. 

Chose a table on the upper level. Table that I sat at was rickety and stuffy. Not sure what people are saying about light and airy, it was anything but..(perhaps the lower level is more airy)

Can't say anything about the food--just had some tea, pretty hard to mess that up. 

Wish I came out of this place being a favorite cafe, but I probably won't be back.
author: Linda C.

description: Great place to get work done - lots of seating, high tables you can stand at. Food looked pretty mediocre but coffee looks good!
author: Alex G.

description:
This is one of my favorite cafe's in the city. They have all of your usual coffee shop drinks, but they also serve some simple food options which is perfect if you haven't had any breakfast or lunch. There are two levels, so there is plenty of room for everyone. And there are a lot of power outlets since the majority of people in the cafe are on their computers. The decor is bright and fun and they play good music.

The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because the gal who took my order was a huge snob. Wouldn't look me in the eye. Just seemed very pissed off. Not the greatest way to greet your customers.
author: Chisholm T.

description:
Pot scented heavy metal music playing staff on Thursday evening when I am simply looking for a good cup of joe and peace while I do my work.

Going downhill since my last visit. No bueno.
author: Sharon M.

description: Another hipster coffee shop with a hipster wifi name, hipster wifi password, and hipster service. No smiles here from staff. Barista filled up my coffee 3/4. I didn't ask for room. Pet peeve. Place was super hot and stuffy.
author: Joy M.

description: Lived by this place for years. Love the staff, vibe, food, and it's a great place to get work done.
author: Gina I.

description: I got an iced latte it was good but not great, I got a tuna melt and was disappointed it just wasn't that good. But the girl at the counter was exceptionally nice so great customer service and cute atmosphere.
author: Kirsten A.

description:
This is another review.

Seriously though, Another Cafe is the cutest and, as suggested by the name, unpretentiously hipster. 

[THE DRANKS] 
The coffee is good and pricey-ish but reasonable (unlike some exorbitantly priced cafes meant to satisfy the hipsterest SF coffee snobs). 

[THE NOMS] 
They serve decent staple cafe food which is not gourmet, but will satisfy munchies after (or before) a long stretch of intense cafe productivity. 

[THE AMBIANCE] 
Quaint though the name sounds, Another Cafe has a nice ambiance that is very conducive to studying: bright, open, outletful, and filled with artwork that screams character and stimulates your mind to cure writer's block. It even has an array of seating, including personal-size small tables, communal tables with high stools, and an upstairs area. 

[THE SIDENOTE]
I was surprised with the health inspection warning because it looks clean (and we didn't get sick, though my sample size is 2). I do think the business needs to address the issue, but until then it is just another pop-up--we all have stomach acid and immune systems.

[THE VERDICT]
No excuses not to get work done here; you can always get another coffee, another snack, move to another spot, or look at another painting.

[THE CATCH]
Ever since coming here, we can never again use the phrase another cafe because it gets confused with Another Cafe.
author: Edna C.

description: So happy this is my neighborhood cafe. It's quiet enough to work with good coffee. Also, whoever is picking the playlist, great music!!
author: Steph S.

description:
Pros: Free wifi. Great place to get some work done (basically everyone is on their laptops). Relaxing hip atmosphere (almost borderline hipster but not really). Amazing panini's for $7-8 (get the garlic chicken!). Good mocha (have yet to try the rest of the coffee). Plenty of seating (downstairs+upstairs). Cool art on the wall. Free photos available to take home near the counter (I grabbed one of London's Big Ben!). 

Cons: I don't think they have air conditioning here...
author: Vicki L.

description: Mediocre coffee and staff that isn't really interested in helping customers. The overall atmosphere is quiet and relaxing compared to corporate coffee chains, but the attitude of the staff is too off putting for a return visit.
author: Jimi B.

description: Such a great cafe to stop by for coffee, food & reading a book or to get some work done. I just had their large Cappuccino and egg & cheese English Muffin. It was a perfect breakfast! Even their seating is pretty nice. I wished I was able to get to this cafe earlier to have a good seating upstairs, but there's always a next time.
author: Vivian L.

description: A friend and I went there for a quick sandwich before we had to head back to work. We literally waited 30 minutes for our to go order, and we were the only ones there that had ordered food. The guy making the sandwiches made the meat sandwich first then wiped his nose as he handed over that one. He then didn't change his gloves while proceeding to make the vegan sandwich. I was so disgusted but no longer had time to wait. I definitely won't be back.
author: Nicole K.

description:
Great place to work or study in Nob Hill. Inoffensive alternative rock playing in the background, but it was easy enough to shut out with headphones. The tables were mostly set up for 1-2 people each, with an outlet by every set that I saw (at least upstairs). 

Food's a little higher priced, but I thought my panini was worth it (~$12). Free, stable wifi that worked well  for the hours I spent there. It was fairly full when I went, but the seating is spread out so it didn't feel crowded.

If you buy food, make sure to ask for water and pick up LOTS of napkins!
author: Varsha S.

description: The food is not that great and the kitchen is not sanitary at all. Last time I was there there were bugs/flies in the pastry display... I used to go there often but haven't been back since then.
author: Neda F.

description:
Great cafe to do some work or study! Good wifi and lots of space including an upstairs with many small tables perfect for one. 

Garlic chicken panini on pita bread is sooo good too! Gotta get it with hot sauce. Yum!! Make sure you have a few napkins though.
author: MaryKate M.

description: Beautiful large cafe, not very special, but also not really bad. The coffee is good, the music a bit too loud, there is only one mixed toilet for the 50 seats that are available and there is unfortunately a choice of food only from bagels, muffins, croissants and the like - no yogurt, scrambled eggs or so.
author: River A.

description: As a work space, Another Cafe is great. Lots of seating, free wifi, pretty quiet, and good music. As a food establishment it is okay. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but you can get a decent breakfast sandwich and coffee on your way by.
author: Beth W.

description: One of the hidden gem at the lower nob area! Wifi is stable and the latte is the bomb! Loving the atmosphere at the cafe ( it's a corner cafe with upstairs attic seating, downstairs tables and small sector inoutdoor predastrian-looking tables) and it's my to go spot during my WFH day!
author: Yuki J.

description:
Popped in to try and get some work in before the week started. Seemed like a great place to hang out and get some work done. Most if not all of the patrons were working on something, which was an encouraging atmosphere to be in. The space is open and airy, and has an upstairs area that probably fills up quickly.

The coffee was okay, and their pastries didn't look that fresh, perhaps because I went on a Sunday afternoon. The tuna melt was pretty tasty. It came on focaccia and was perfectly panini'd.
author: Julia N.

description:
Stopped by for a quick hot cocoa break after a windy and cold adventure in Nob Hill. This place is charming and has some pretty cool wall art. It's small but there's a second story with more seatings as well. 

The pastries and hot chocolate was good, the cashier was really friendly, will definitely come back next time we're in SF!
author: Quynh N.

description: Came here to study for a bit, nice place to chill and do your thing. I really liked their veggie sandwich. Will come back again. Service was fast, and the server was very nice :)
author: Fay A. V.

description: Awesome Staff! Coffee made with love and it tastes that way! I frequent this cafe and would highly recommend it. Good food and beer selection too!
author: Andrew S.

description:
This is not just another cafe in the city. It serves great sandwiches and delicious Bicycle Coffee (local & organic).

My friend and I split the Veggie Panini. They use a toasted seeded flatbread and it is SO FREAKING CRISPY. The melted cheese + bread combo is definitely on point. I didn't even miss not having any meat! 

With TWO stories, it is a great place to chill or work. It's far enough from the main hustle&bustle of Union Square and the super congested areas, but close enough to be accessible via public transit or walking.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Looking for a quick bite in Nob Hill, we came to Another Cafe to give it a shot. This is a pretty small cafe with a friendly vibe. It seems like the baristas were very familiar and friendly with their customers, which is always a plus at cafes! While the workers were really nice I don't think the value was quite there.

Though the waiters were really friendly, it did take a while for them to get an egg bacon and cheese muffin and egg and cheese bagel out. We were the only ones ordering food and really the only customers with food orders so it was surprising how long it took. The food, while it was tasty, I don't think the value was really there. I think the muffin I ordered was pretty comparable to an egg mcmuffin from McD's but cost over $5! The bagel with egg and cheese, about $7, was good but also not a great value proposition. 

Overall I could see this as being a cool cafe to get some work done and become a regular, but I would go somewhere else for food.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Load and terrible music! The music changes based on who works in that day. Any given day you might hear American pop, Turkish, Arabic music or Hip hop blasting. Last, but not least their grilled cheese sandwich comes unmelted and almost cold. I only come here for the free wifi.
author: Brooke S.

description:
Two story, quiet cafe with a pretty solid menu. Cold brew isn't bad, but I loved the ham and swiss on the croissant. The second floor has tables and a nice overlook of the rest of the cafe. Definitely worth stopping in for a quiet break from the rest of the day.
Don't be thrown off by the amount of people ordering decaf soy lattes, they have real coffee too.
author: Neto M.

description: Always really full in the shop, hard to find a seat. People come here to use Wi-Fi, but Wi-Fi not really stable in the shop. The place still good for studying or working, there have pretty big tables.Sometimes cold, sometimes hot in the shop, because there don't have air conditioner.
author: Irene W.

description:
Okay, so the Chai here is something else! Plenty of creamy creamy foam on top but not so much that only half the cup is actual liquid (cough cough Jane on Larkin). In addition, it's sweet and delicious not overly spicy. LOVE this Chai.  I got a small Chai and a parfait cup for roughly $7 and I was totally full and satisfied after.  
In addition, this place has two stories of seating to choose from and super cool wall art all along the top floor. Love sitting up on the balcony and overlooking the rest of the cafe like the magnificent eagle that I was meant to be. 
Another Cafe is what's up.
author: Tamara S.

description:
I'm big on scoping out places to quietly do work and this cafe was EXACTLY what I was looking for. It's cozy enough to casually have a conversation with those around you, but it's just as easy to throw on some headphones and get work done.

The first floor is the most social spot, where there is a a row of "couples" tables and large "social" tables along the walls. All of the walls have art hanging on them which makes for a nice ambiance.

The second floor is more quiet and if you can snag a table, it's a great place to hide and get into your "zone", or work privately with friends / colleagues.

The only downside I've found so far is getting here (having to climb the mountain that is Taylor St), and the coffee portions. A medium is still pretty small, but effective.
author: Zachary S.

description:
It's a good place to eat breakfast and relax in weekend morning.
The Turkey / Turkey Cranberry Panini Recommended.
Maybe u should try it next time.
author: Vico L.

description:
I LOVE this venue! With large corner windows it makes the whole café bright and full of air. It has a modern look to it and the upstairs is a perfect place to go study or work in piece. They have nice and loungy music which adds to the whole atmosphere. 

The coffee is alright, not the best in SF but their bagels made up for it. I had the bacon, egg and cheddar bagel during a particularly long study session, it was amazing! This is for sure my new favourite spot to study!
author: Camilla E.

description:
Mediocre coffee but fantastic study atmosphere.
Students yes...
Coffee enthusiasts, no.
author: Johannah F.

description: Not the most glamorous place but solid place to work. The coffee is nothing to write home about and they only really have bagels food wise. But there is an upstairs area with plenty of seats and plugs and Internet. Came here with my husband on his work trip, and it was down the street from our hotel. He has come back to work here several times since.
author: Alyssa H.

description: Staff needs to chill out. At the end of the day this is a coffee shop for their customers.They treat it as if it's their hang out spot to bump music and have get togethers. Not saying they're bad people by any means, but if I have to turn up my headphones to full volume just to drown out their convos and personal music... I think it's a problem.
author: Mike B.

description: Just another day at another cafe. I'm usually not the loyal return customer type but this place has me coming back for more. The wifi is fast AF, the coffee is good not the best I've had but good nonetheless. There's like 3 beers on tap if you need to spike your work\study sesh. The music is amazing I never put my earphones in there's no point. The staff is laid back and friendly. I've not ordered any food from here but it always smells pretty good like you would get at any cafe. There's a 2nd level which is kinda low on headspace but there are enough windows to get some fresh air rolling in. Also the artwork makes you feel like you're not so boxed in. I've had a great productive experience every time. Highly recommend this place but I don't want too many people to catch onto this place LOL Stay away!
author: Chantelle T.

description: Nice cosy atmoshphere. Not super trendy although there is an upstairs with some cool wall paintings. Tasty latte (and good price) and loads of cream cheese on the bagel.
author: Alexander P.

description:
All of the another cafe puns have been taken so I will get to knitty gritty of this place if you are in the area looking for a cafe. SF is kind of built on local coffee shops and this place is right in line with those. It can be over crowded with one or two on every corner. Another Cafe has found its spot on Leavenworth and is far enough of the sutter path to stand on its own. Especially for those that live in the area it feels like you have found your own little oasis. 

The staff is very welcoming and the breakfast and sandwich options are decent. There is nothing that really stands out on the menu but you aren't coming to a place like this to have fine dining. Its usually to grab something edible in the morning before work or something to chew on while you work on a project. 

This is what i really like about this place. Similar to borderlands except they actually have wifi which can either distract you from your work or make it possible. There is ample seating downstairs and upstairs and plenty of room for groups of people to work which is not something i can really say for the other cafes in the area as they are usually crammed into very small spaces. 

I nice little place to get your work done or stop for a quick coffee or smoothing break. Nothing to flashy but it gets the job done which many times is all you are looking for.
author: Nick R.

description: Great place to sit and get some work or studying done. Their coffee and sandwiches are very good, I specially liked their grilled cheese. Free wifi and there are outlets if you need to charge your equipment. Interiors have interesting wall art and the lighting is appropriate. The mezzanine seems cozy if you need more privacy and need to sit alone.
author: Lorely G.

description:
I came here for a quick bite before catching a show at the Masonic and got the caprese panini ($9). The bread and aioli were ridiculously delicious. 

There were only two people to take orders and make the drinks and sandwiches, so there was a bit of a wait to get our food but it was still a quick option for us since it was so close to the Masonic. 

There was plenty of seating on Saturday evening upstairs, but tall folks beware: I'm only 5'2 and could easily touch the ceiling. There were lots of people hanging out and working downstairs and I could see why; the food is great, bathroom is clean, wifi is good. I'll probably be back to get some work done.
author: Diana N.

description: It's ok but I am a true fan to another! I will come in here if I am in the area though! I enjoyed just a straight good old black cup of coffee here. I stopped cream and sugar in my coffee years ago, so o can really taste just the coffee beans that way. I recommend these guys!
author: Kirk M.

description:
Found this place on Yelp's Ten best free Wi-fi study places in SF.  Checked in and got a some FREE chips with purchase...SCORE! Me loves free stuff :) 

Overall good, fast service... a Pastrami sandwich was $8.95.  It has art murals on the walls even the bathroom!  Good chilled out music that is not disruptive for studying or working.  Most ppl in here are busy on their laptops so noise is kept to a minimum.  Only gave it 4 stars cuz when I came in at 9am wi-fi was fast but now that there are several ppl here wi-fi is pretty slow :/  I will still come back though. :)
author: Alex M.

description:
I love this spot in the city! They have the most friendly staff out of all other coffee shops I go to. Great environment to get some work done or even get beer after I get my work done. 

This is a friendly neighborhood cafe that I go out of my way to be at. You can catch  me upstairs with my laptop getting my work done. It's also a great spot bc they have good food, so I don't need to go elsewhere to get lunch. 

I forgot to mention, the owner is super cool too!
author: Raven N.

description:
SERVICE:
Free wifi.

ATMOSPHERE:
Cute artsy atmosphere, love the creative murals all around, love the artwork that they featured and hung up. 

11.11.13
author: Angela L.

description:
Kind of joke name but that's all good because the staff doesn't have much of a sense of humor, seriously and sorry. Not unfriendly but just without mirth with their guests. The space is cool with two tops snd a communal table on the first floor snd more on the mezzanine. Everybody loves a mezzanine! 
The coffee is average, the food is average, the vibe is studious and the location is good if you live around the area
author: Tommy W.

description:
What a relief to have Another Cafe in this city! The first time I heard of this spot I was eavesdropping in another conversation in another cafe. (No pun intended. And yes, I'm aware that last comment sounded super creepster-y. I mean, they were talking loudly anyway...)  Someone asked the barista of a coffeehouse open beyond 8 and they suggested Another Cafe. I Yelp bookmarked it, visited it, and have remained a happy customer since. 

Located at the corner of Pine and Leavenworth, Another Cafe is two stories. It doesn't look very big from the outside, but it is. The bottom floor has long community tables with stools and numerous 2-people tables. Upstairs there is limited seating; they are definitely appropriate for studying. Another Cafe serves Bicycle Coffee and like others have noted, their beverage and food prices are reasonable. But what distinguishes Another Cafe from other places is the service and ambiance. The baristas are incredibly friendly and probably the nicest ones I can think of in this city. They also bump good music. One minute it's R&B, next it's rock, and then it's folk. Along with that, the environment is unpretentious and relaxed.
author: James Z.

description: This is my third time here, love this cafe.  It is walking distance from my daughter's apt on Bush Street.  Love the atmosphere, the staff is friendly, the coffee drinks are great.  There are always a lot of people there and they have a small outside seating area which is really nice. Prices are reasonable.  I will be back again!
author: Karen G.

description: Mocha Coffee is my favorite at this store. Location is convenient too. I always come here to work and studies. Great place for that !
author: Mark C.

description: Their sandwiches are really good. Go for the club.  I have had it twice and both times were amazing. Generally I take my food to go but recently I have stopped in a few times to get a drink and hang out for a little bit. The staff is kind of quiet and really only ask you the important questions but no real thrills -- Like a lot of places in San Francisco. Bring your own headphones if you don't like the music. Breakfast is also very good and like the sandwiches a tiny bit over-priced but nothing crazy. I will still go back because it is a great place to eat, work and grab a drink.
author: Rick T.

description:
Great spot to study or get work done. Good natural lighting, plenty of space and outlets, and (usually) reliable wi-fi.  As a bonus, music is usually not too loud and is good background (ie radiohead or deadmau5) versus other cafes that have distracting music. They are also open late-ish for procrastinators like me. 

I've been to quite a few cafes in the city and so far this is my go-to for getting work done.
author: Detoxreto X.

description:
It's Another Cafe where you can go in and get some work done. The second floor quite and beautiful with a nicely painted mural. Have a seat while sipping their White Mocha with whipped cream; it's smooth and aromatic. 

TIP: The best seat in the house if you need to get some work done is on the second floor, left corner next to the huge open window. You'll get a nice view of the city outside as well as fresh air. There is also an outlet below if you need to charge your laptops. The internet, however, goes in and out at times.
author: Edwina L.

description:
How did I not know, this new cafe was one block away from my wk? The way I found out was through what hot new business are in town. Once I read the reviews, I planned to go there for lunch the next day. 

Upon walking in, as I looked through the windows the cafe looked contemporary compared to what it used to be which was a liquor store. The menu consisted of coffee, tea, pastries and sammiches. I decided to order the pastrami panini.. results? yum! Very generous with the deli meat and prepared with pesto mayo, cheese, tomatoes, and fresh greens. 

I'll be back!
author: Kathy V.

description:
Another Cafe is a hidden local coffee spot on the corner of Pine Street. Inside it opens up a bit and has plenty of tables to sit and do your Laptop thing, and there are a bunch more tables upstairs, where you can hideaway doing your on-line dating selections, Facebook updates, or concentrate writing your next great novel. But it gets hot upstairs on nice days, which is when I went, on an unusually warm evening in SF in October. 

The vibe is chill, and I liked the music mix the Barrista brought in, a funky, eclectic jumble of old school  R&B and the like that was his personal choices. 

Coffee was good and the service was friendly and efficient. Definitely a place to do your laptop homework with a cup of joe, like everyone else in here.
author: Wanugee N.

description: I LOVE Another Cafe! I get my morning coffee here almost every morning! The food is AMAZING...the Tuna Melt is one of my favorites! Highly recommend Another Cafe for breakfast, lunch and/or dinner!
author: Mary M.

description: Great Turkish coffee (Zoe's).  Nice hand brewed, with a touch of Cardamon.  Unique & well worth travelling for on Friday mornings.
author: The P.

description:
This cafe, yet, Another Cafe, is everything you want your local cafe to be and offer. For the majority of Yelpers that want a place to open up their labtops and clicks away for hours, this is the place.They utilized their limited real estate well, staff is friendly and they offer a great variety and reasonable price offerings for the area. 

They also offer an ample amount of AC power to connect your power hungry devices, that caters well to their clientele. 

Coffee is hot and delicious. Wifi is reasonably fast and free. Seating is plentiful with a great mix of patrons.
author: Tim D.

description:
3.5 stars really 

Pro's:
quite few tables and even more upstairs in the loft area
open early 6 am
good coffee- pretty strong
separate compost/recycling/landfill bins
have some quick food options

Con:
They only had one person working in the early morning so there was a bit of a line when I stopped by around 7:20 on a Thursday, it didn't take eons, but not ideal if your rushing in the morning to get to work. 

I would go back
author: Javi Alexa A.

description: I just needed a place to do work and I found this spot. I liked it a lot, they have drinks and food. The place have 2 floors, so if you want to get away from people you can go upstairs( with the view of downstairs). If you check in on yelp you do get a free size with an order of sandwich. I got a turkey sandwich and I liked it.  They have computer plugs in many places so that's a positive. They have a bathroom also. I'd come back to this place to study.
author: Shirley W.

description: I was actually really hesitant to go in here because I just didn't like the name. It sounded a little stand off-ish. But oh my gosh, I'm so glad I did. It is soooo cute, and the play on words actually made me enjoy the place more. The art display on the walls is appealing, the loft section is great, the music was nice and good volume, and customer service was pretty decent. I had the cold brew which I thought was weird with the ice cubes at first but I definitely enjoyed it. I wonder if they've thought about cold brew ice cubes? That would prevent it from getting watery which was my only minor complaint. I also love that they're open until 10pm. This is the kind of coffee shop I've been wanting to find!
author: Christopher J.

description: I have lived across from this cafe for 2 years... the coffee is good, although the people who have taken my order are unfriendly 4/5 times. Good place to grab something to go.
author: Katherine W.

description: I came to this place excited with high expectations however there were a couple of things I didn't like. The wifi doesn't work, an Arnold Palmer was priced way too much for such a small basic drink, and the service was horrible. There was no one at the cafe and they have forgotten my order and was too busy with their boyfriend. Also the people seemed a bit irritated for not being ready to order. The only thing I liked about this place was the design, the amount of plugs they have, and the food
author: Eileen Joy P.

description: Nice ambiance, good room temperature (many cafes can be super cold), and a good place to get some work done. The coffee is pretty good, my only suggestion is to watch the temperature when steaming the milk. A latte should be at about 160 degrees and mine was at about 185/190 degrees (a latte shouldn't burn your tongue a couple minutes after it was made). Also mind that non-dairy milk (soy, almond) will burn at high temperatures exceeding 160 degrees.
author: Julia K.

description:
My husband and I moved to this neighborhood in 2011 before this coffee shop was open. We've been able to see Another Cafe develop over the last few years. They've grown a lot since their beginning days.
The staff there are very friendly and will make your order as soon as possible. I appreciate that the owner is always around and knows the community.
author: Kay A.

description:
Another Cafe is a my favorite spot to work or study.  The place is bright, inviting, and have adequate number of seating (they have seating upstairs as well).  They also have good sandwiches, snacks and coffee at a fairly reasonable price.  The service is friendly, but often times, slow.  It's not a huge deal to me, because I'm usually not in a rush when I go there.  

I've stayed for as long as 5 hours to study for a final, and none of the workers made me feel like I had a rush out and go.  I appreciated that.  However, as courtesy, I always make sure to buy something throughout my stay.  

I would have given this place 5 stars, except I think there's one thing they can improve on -- their 1 bathroom!!!  Though I'm not asking that they add more bathrooms, I wish they'd clean it once in a while.  It's always filthy!  Nobody seems to bother to check if there's enough toilet paper, toilet seat covers, or paper towels.

Other than the bathroom situation, I really do enjoy this place a lot!
author: Khristine A.

description: Food is ok but I can make a chai latte at home with trader joes mix that's better. Their real downfall is that they move slower than I have ever seen humans move before. It is painful how long it takes them to do things.
author: Taylor T.

description:
Great place to chill and work! Good coffee and a fun, friendly staff. Their sandwiches are pretty decent, I liked the pastrami a lot and the pesto turkey was alright. There is plenty of space to work, with large bar-tables with stools as well as individual tables on the 1st floor and 2nd floor loft. Open til 10 on weekdays, which is great for the area!

UPDATE: Garlic chicken sandwich is amazing.
author: Ryan D.

description: A pretty shop. I can work quietly on the second floor. Some people are quiet on the first floor and work as a standing desk, and it is easy to work.
author: Miwa I.

description:
CHILL SPACE: Stopped in here for a couple hours at night to get some work done and really enjoyed the relaxing vibe.

Ordered an Arnold Palmer and picked up a slice of wrapped cream cheese pumpkin bread while I was at it -- Arnold Palmer was okay and pumpkin bread was really moist & tasty. No minimum on credit cards. Very friendly service from a couple of guys behind the counter; one helped me find the straws which are hidden in plain sight on the counter with the sugar and coffee lids -- look for a black dispenser about the size of a toaster behind the sugar packets -- hit the clear plastic tab at the bottom to get yourself a fresh straw. Just like the 1950s, dude!

Wifi Password: anotherpassword

I sat upstairs on a vinyl sofa cushion running next to a big open window, plugged in, and enjoyed the mellow vibe. Music is easily tuned out if you are easily distracted like me. At night, the balcony upstairs is lit from the soft cream lighting coming from the hanging lights. You can hide and nerd out in peace and comfort.

Bathroom: A bit messy with an overflowing paper towel trash bin, but toilet and sink were clean and there was tons of toilet paper and seat covers.

Nice place for getting work done, or messing around on the web.
author: Sarah J.

description: Awesome spot to work. Lots of tables, and outlets. Coffee and price are good. Music is a bit loud, but I prefer it to people's chatter. Baristas are nice. Menu is decent. Overall I feel lucky this is the closest coffee spot to me.
author: Raquel L.

description:
To me, best coffee shop in San Francisco :) great quiet place to work (the mezzanine is just GREAT), have a real coffee (they serve Bicycle Coffee, reaaally good) while listening to good music. So yeah, guess I'm in love with this place :)

Tip: try their iced coffee, best I ever had.
author: Charlotte D.

description: Nice place! The iced latte is spot-on, service is good and there's a cute doggy in the house. Nice people-watching spot too.
author: Allison L.

description:
Perfect for doing a little work in the upstairs loft that has plenty of seating and ample outlets positioned right by the tables. Also, there's no annoying blending noises, because they don't sell frapps or smoothies. Yay for no noisy disruptions! 

Good vibe, good music, clean/spacious bathroom, and free wifi. The wifi was a tad slow (2mbps down / 0.91 up), which is why I knocked off a star. Perhaps it was just really crowded on this sunny Saturday afternoon. It was hard to load multiple pages at once, but these speeds would definitely prevent downloading. 

As for drinks, I like the house iced tea, which is a ginger peach black tea :)
author: Audrey L.

description: super cute cafe in nob hill! i've always liked its name too, funny and ironic. usually come here in the mornings for coffee - always yum - and they have a good variety of cold bottled drinks and food selection! grab a chair by the window or a table outside for some people watchin'
author: Christina L.

description:
Super chill vibe here. I love the graffiti and pop art on the walls. Wifi. Two levels of seats. It's a popular place to work, so you may have a hard time snagging a seat. Whenever I grab one, I feel like I've won the lottery. It can be pretty loud sometimes.

The coffee is solidly good. I think they still use Bicycle beans, which is rad. The food is tasty. I go for the veggie sandwich, which is good, solid nourishment while working. Always service with a smile.
author: Jen H.

description: One of my favorite cafes to get work done. Love the mocha or white mocha. Workers are so nice too!
author: Shabnam E.

description:
chai: 3 stars. Decent sweet chai, no foam. Seems to be more of a coffee place.
vibe: good chill tunes, chill workers, chill crowd on laptops.
speed: 17u / 6.5d, nice.
Top it all off with seating upstairs and down, lots of outlets, and you've got yourself a cool little neighborhood working cafe. Very easy to get lost in your work here.
author: Linus W.

description:
Most excellent study spot! Great music, open until 10pm, has food, friendly barista service, free wifi. 

Only complaint: $1.75 for coffee refill??? Sheesh.
author: Adele A.

description:
It's a great space, and a nice place to get work done. 

The music is terrible, though. If I were deaf or retarded, I'd give it a 5/5.
author: Tyler H.

description:
I'm just so excited we finally have a coffee shop on Pine located so conveniently across the street from my apartment!  It's just a nice, standard cafe with pastries, sandwiches, and good coffee.  Oh they also had carrot juice which I was extra excited about.  The people that work there that I have encountered so far have all been funny and very friendly.  

Some other perks I am thankful for?  There are a couple of outdoor tables as well as free WiFi.  

Oh one last thing... they don't accept credit cards.  Hopefully they will in the future, but until then they do have an ATM machine.
author: Jessica F.

description: I needed to find a close cafe that was open from early morning to have a business meeting. I was looking for something non-commercial, with a good working atmosphere. Another Cafe is on a corner in lower nob hill very close to the hustle and bustle of union square, but far enough away that it isn't crowded. The chai tea latte here is one of the best I've ever had! The balcony seating made it easy for me to have a business meeting and talk in private. The food options were many and were healthy.
author: Alisa K.

description: I used to love coming here- chill baristas and nice background music. Now the baristas have attitude and they play the WORST rap-style music. I only come in when they aren't playing it, it's loud and distracting and inappropriate for a coffee shop. The assistant manager is here when they play it, so obviously it's not going to change... The drinks and food are fine and wifi is good.
author: Diana C.

description: Another Coffee Shop isn't the best place ever, but it's pretty good if you live in the lower nob hill area and want some pretty good coffee and a place to work. It would get another star if their internet were more reliable or their food were better. Still, a pretty good place on the whole.
author: Stalag T.

description: I want to give a Special Thanks to the morning crew! They truly helped make my wedding day an awesome experience. We would have not made it through the day with out the breakfast they prepared for us. I placed a large breakfast order for the morning of my wedding and they had everything thing ready, delicious and on point. Not to mention they had prepared my favorite breakfast croissant for me to enjoy that morning. Just an amazing experience and I'm glad they are in my neighborhood. The staff is always awesome here and this is just a another great example of it. Thanks so much!
author: Jorge C.

description: Great place to get work done. Staff are really nice, coffee is good/relatively cheap, and the background music is at the perfect volume to be productive.
author: Danny L.

description:
3.5 stars. But I'll round up because you can't put 3.5 and they are semi pet friendly. Great coffee and tea although pricey refills. 5 star for coffee tastes. But I had a3$ glass of tea with a 3$ refill. It's weird as most places tea refills are free especially since it costs 10 cents to make a tea. I like their little breakfast sandwiches and I LOVE THEIR LUNCH SANDWICHES.  
2 stars for the price of tea and 5 star for lunch sandwich. Service is ok. They r not that into it. Kindof "out there." They're ok nice but a little spacey. "Dude! I lost your order, uh huh, uh huh. Dude I'm so sorry"
This place is extremely well built with two stories of tables and free wifi. Great for work 5 starssssssss for that.
author: Marie A.

description:
I had a hot chocolate which was good but too sweet for my taste (I asked for an unsweetened one) and the pita bread sandwich with rotisserie chicken and hot sauce. The sandwich was good but the sauce was not hot... :) My sandwich was made on the spot and it took around 7 minutes to get it. Not too bad!

Service was good but the waiter seemed to be aloof.
author: Flora F.

description: The coffee is delicious here, although the service could maybe be a bit friendlier. I'll put up with it because the espresso is worth is. They also sell gluten-free cookies -- I haven't tried them but I appreciate their offering them! It looks like a nice place to get some work done, especially because of the colorful paintings lining the upper balcony seating.
author: Patricia D.

description:
Another Cafe is similar to that friend's place you always end up after a crazy night -- no judgments, good food and a warm drink await you. It's a really low-key place with pleasantly friendly service. I've never ordered anything I didn't like and the atmosphere was perfect for seeing a friend or working on my thesis.

Only downside is seating can be tough if it's a popular time of day. But don't forget the upstairs section -- there's a cool mural there.
author: Eva R.

description:
Great work spot and tasty fresh paninis.. I'm a fan of the turkey panini, but the pastrami is also pretty money. They run about 7 bucks with tax.

The real beauty of this spot is the ample work space... I love the funky decor and the upstairs loft right next to windows for fresh air.

ProTip: go upstairs and post up next to the 3 open windows upstairs for fresh ventillation and study space. Ample outlets and free wifi with purchase.

Cool spot for sure.
author: Roy C.

description:
This is the best cafe ever!  Comfortable and clean environment, lots of natural light, plenty of seating and plugs for laptops.  They have a nice upstairs seating area which is breezy and great for getting work done.

The food and drinks are delicious, the people who work here are friendly, and the music is awesome!  The baristas play music from their ipods so you hear stuff like Drake and reggae instead of crappy Starbucks music.  They also have some seating outside which is great for nice weather and people watching.

Highly recommended!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Another Cafe really isn't just another cafe - because it's actually pretty hard to find a good cafe with free wi-fi to work at these days! Every coffee shop these days is third wave and the size of your first studio apartment, with no wi-fi or seating to speak of. It's kind of frustrating. 

Another Cafe answers to this. Their roast is bold and tasty, but they don't offer anything novelty in terms of drinks or pastries. I guess that's where the "Another Cafe" part comes in. They're pretty no-fuss here.

I love bi-level cafes. Sitting up top working on my computer against the mural'd walls for a couple hours was pretty nice. Everyone here is doing the same thing too. Have them watch your stuff while you pee.
author: K M.

description:
Whoever curates the music for this cafe is my soundtrack soul mate! This is the first cafe where, when I pencil in a visit, I decide to leave headphones behind because I know they'll play the right mix of indie, instrumental tracks to carry me through a productive weekend afternoon. (The likes of the XX, Explosions in the Sky, Rogue Wave, Modest Mouse...it's like they uploaded my ipod here)

Anyway, music aside, it's a wonderful work space. There's a smartly designed upstairs loft area that overlooks a clean, neautrals-dominated interior. The floor to ceiling windows by the street allow for copious people-watching, but Pine and Leavenworth is in quieter Lower Nob Hill, so keeping the cafe door open doesn't have to equal noise pollution. The baristas are friendly, didn't entertain my attempt to start a real conversation, but that's OK. They do their jobs well and the wait is never long for espresso drinks.

For comestibles, I've had the bear claw and blueberry muffin. Muffin is decent, nothing special, but their bear claw is delicious! The black coffee is bitter but didn't seem as strong as other dark brews I've had, so meh. But their espresso is awesome! I would recommend an americano, definitely.


In my opinion, this is the best work/study cafe in the area. Echelons above FiDi cafes jammed full of stressed out people, more affordable and suited for camping out in as compared to high-end North Beach places, and with music and a layout like Another Cafe's?

Just come.
author: Cathy H.

description: My chai latte was as expected. The place is super casual and chill. I imagine Rowling wrote her wizard books in a place such as this, only, you know, in England. Tons of plugs, which is why I stopped in. The mezze was nice, great view of the front door, which is important if you're a spy... Like me... Cheers
author: Jason D.

description:
Another Cafe is just that, another cafe in a city chock full of coffee shops. Unlike many of the corporate cafes in San Francisco where people come to congregate and socialize under the oppressive din of some store branded Muzak, Another Cafe is an excellent place to grab a cappuccino, iced coffee or a regular drip in relative peacefulness. Bicycle Coffee is served here, delivered on bicycle as the name may suggest.

There are about eight small tables downstairs, accommodating two each. There are is a small bar seating area near the entrance, a small communal table with bar stools, and an upstairs seating area that is accessed up an incredibly vertical, narrow, uneven, rickety stairway. 

There is free two hour street parking nearby on Pine, free WiFi, and a relatively quiet environment that is excellent for a small meeting or for some quiet reading or writing time.

My sole gripe is this: I will say that the service here is the typical modern nonchalance that you get at many businesses today. That is definitely something that they can work on as a lesson learned from their lesser corporate competition. 

Otherwise, this is a fine place to sip on a cup of coffee and get some work done.
author: .Alan Y.

description:
The employees are really nice and friendly. There is a ton of seating and plenty of places to plug in a laptop. 

They have a second floor that is perfect for working quietly or having a meeting with someone in private. The top floor overlooks Leavenworth so you can people watch. 

I really like their veggie sandwich, they don't have a ton of veggie options but what they do have, I enjoy. Definitely a place you can spend hours working.
author: Amy A.

description: This is my new favorite. I spend like 2hrs a day here. Love this cafe. And yes when you are hungry you have some food options as well. I get a lot of this done here and you can even sit upstairs!!!
author: Bimarsh S.

description:
This is my go-to cafe on my lunch breaks. 

I enjoy the atmosphere here-private enough to be on my laptop but still not be in a room by myself. The decorated artsy wall is welcoming and the staff are friendly.
The free wifi here is great- no lags.The paninis are tasty and the drinks are decent here. Love that they have pastries here tooo-sometimes when I am in the mood to get a snack i can definitely count on getting one here.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
The coffee and food here are merely OK, but service is super sweet, friendly, and personal. It's not part of a large chain; it's just a simple neighborhood cafe. 

Indeed, it's a beautiful neighborhood space for all types of people. The counter at the window allows for conversation and people watching (beware the strong afternoon sun). Lots of small tables downstairs accommodate workers and conversationalists, plus there's a long, high communal table for larger groups. The surprisingly large loft upstairs is a hidden gem and is a quieter, more private space to work. Lots and lots of power ports throughout. Again, a truly cozy neighborhood hangout.
author: Vincent L.

description: Very nice place. Had some nice charm to it. Loved my drink; it was just a Arnold Palmer but great.
author: Brian W.

description:
This review is a bit overdue, but better late than never, right? 

The latte: makes you salivate uncontrollably (and very unattractively) until you finally get your morning fix. I'm specifically talking about the vanilla latte. 

The tuna melt: so $%@!#& GOOD! I mean who doesn't like a toasted focaccia with half a pound of melted cheese and creamy yet chunky tuna? I could eat this ish every day. 

The service: really good, never had a problem. I like their easy pay system. The owner is pretty hot, too! 

The vibe: it gets crowded (with lots of hipsters), so I prefer a table upstairs to scarf down my food in peace and privacy. 

Moral of the story, if you're in this part of the hood, this is not just 'Another Cafe'.... this is THE cafe.
author: Michelle S.

description: Barista chick or whatever the hell you're supposed to call them now was pretty rude. Ordered an iced chai and she gave me a cup of milk with ice. She plopped it on the counter and walked away. I didn't feel like asking the emo hipster chick to make me a new one since apparently her life looked hard enough as it is with strenuous work as an edgy hip barista.
author: L N.

description:
Still coffee is good but some guys behind the counter need more attention to BASIC customer service skills. ( i mean really basic like smile:) hello, good morning, good evening etc. ) Not a rocket science:( 
I hope they are not trying to be like another ritual coffee example.
author: Lyra S.

description:
Another Cafe is NOT just any other cafe. Cheesy, I know. This place was my spot almost every day for 3 months while I studied for the GMAT. Great vibe with generally good music. Love their chai latte and the employees are really cool. Sometimes it can get a bit loud so I always brought earplugs which helped. Plenty of seating as there is an upstairs area too (lighting isn't great but it's sufficient).

My absolute favorite aspect is the fact that it's open pretty late for a cafe!
author: Salma R.

description:
Two stars just for the ambiance that is kind of nice. 
But I ordered a bacon breakfast sandwich, for which I paid almost 6 dollars, and I'm sure it was one of those microwaveable sandwiches out of a box, because, besides tasting badly, I didn't see anybody cooking the bacon or melting the cheese. Mac Donalds would've tasted the same and cost way less.
author: Ana Carolina J.

description:
This is my first time to go to here. This place is great, and their food is delicious. 
My friend and I wanted to find a place to rest, and we found it on Yelp. There are two floors in this cafe. Actually we were working, so we went to upstairs to hide. This was a good place to hide. People can't see who is on upstairs. When we considered what we would order,the server gave some suggests to us. Even though I asked a lot of questions, the server also had a big smile and answered all of my questions completely. Finally, I bought a turkey panini and my friend just bought an ice tea(because she is on a diet). The turkey panini was hot and delicious. It smelled so good. After my friend took a bite of my pain in, she ran immediately to cashier and ordered one. She forgot she was on a diet. 
Another Cafe is a good place to study too. They provide free WIFI for customers, so many people take a notebook here for studying. Next time I will bring my homework and enjoy my panini here.
author: Boo L.

description:
Pretty solid cafe in the tenderloin. Plenty of tables and even an upstairs section. Free wifi. Great place to come and get some work done. They serve sandwiches, breakfast, and salads.

Crowd is mid 20s to 30s. Come here and be seen with your macbook air!
author: Andy J.

description: Husband and I stopped for coffee while strolling around Nob Hill area. My latte and his regular coffee were amazing! Must be the organic beans or something. Peanut butter/fudge cookie was good too, but it was vegan so a bit crumbly. We were the oldest people in there by decades as everyone sitting "plugged in" on a Sunday early evening were hipster 25-30 year olds on their laptops. Would go back for sure to try to the sandwiches next time.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Why the heck do I always return here?

Good coffee? No. If you do business in SF, it automatically is quality.
Cool atmosphere? No. WiFi, art, and hipster Macbookers are citywide mandates.
Good looking baristas?
Studious but not library quiet?
No credit card minimum?
Great music?

No. No. No. No.

I return because of the beige accent wall. 
Seriously. 
It's the kind of wall that makes me want to move to Nob Hill.
author: AJ G.

description:
I was torn between 4 and 5 stars here, and went ahead and gave them all 5, because they really are doing a great thing without a whole lot of fanfare.
I really enjoy searching out good quality espresso drinks, so I was excited to come to the city for an internship this summer.  I read numerous 'top 10' lists and saved them all on my phone.
