Then on my second day, I walked a block to this place just to grab a quick afternoon cup and was blown away!  My standard order is a vanilla soy latte, and this one was up there with some of the most celebrated spots in the city.  I've been several more times since then, and both the service and lattes have been spot on every time.  Once I even had to go back in the afternoon asking for a receipt for a staff outing so I could submit for reimbursement, and the barista was very helpful and courteous.  
I haven't had the opportunity to sit and work, but the upstairs balcony always calls to me.  I leave in a couple weeks, so I need to make sure to do it before then!
author: Calee S.

description:
Another Cafe is my new favorite go-to cafe to get some work done. Everything food and drink related is decent. Decent coffee, decent sandwiches, and even decent beer. The major selling point is the actual shop. There is tons of seating and outlets EVERYWHERE. The wifi is free and works well. My favorite part of the shop is the upstairs loft-like area where it's a little quieter - perfect for reading, working, and people-watching as it overlooks the downstairs.

Honestly, I would not come here for grab and go, and I'm only basing this off of weekdays in the morning/afternoon, but if you are looking for somewhere to sit down and work or chat, definitely check this place out.
author: Stephan C.

description: This place is an ideal location for those vagabond studiers who can't stand being locked in the confines of a cramped study. The artwork along the walls and Hispanic themed music are pretty soothing plus the free wifi and numerous outlets throughout the cafe make this even more ideal for studying. Albeit many of the tables are pretty small and can feel cramped at times, it doesn't really affect the whole experience once you start getting sucked into your work. The cafe has a second floor which is more cramped, but isolates one better from everything else. My only complaint is that they don't provide any cooling which makes it pretty warm, especially upstairs, but as long as you're dressed appropriately and maybe get a iced beverage you should be fine. I'm yet to experience the food they provide, but it looked and was priced pretty decently.
author: Chad K.

description: Love this place for the garlic chicken pita wrap (with hot sauce). Great place to get work done with lots of outlets for laptops. Only complaint is that they regularly thump bass heavy tunes which no headphones can drown out. I'd recommend they turn down/off their sub so clientele not interested in their music aren't subjugated to it.
author: Michael B.

description: My only complaint is that they ran out of bagels and other pastries. I feel deprived. But I can't complain because everything we ordered was delicious.
author: Caesar E.

description:
This isn't the greatest cafe in the world, it's not somewhere I'd go to catch up with friends and I probably wouldn't make a habit of heading here if it wasn't so close to me.... but I still give it a solid four stars! 

Another Cafe is pretty much a library with coffee (and without books... so maybe less library, more study hall). It has free wifi and heaps of tables available for working/studying... which explains why the place is full of 20-30 somethings typing away on their macs from open to close! It's a great work environment... not too much noise, staff are happy to let you sit around for hours at a time and enough "life" in the place that you don't feel like you're in an office. 

I've had a couple of sandwiches and usually grab a latte... both were pretty tasty and reliable. 

As my job hunt continues, I'll be making Another Cafe a regular place to spend my days! Great SF find!
author: Guida B.

description:
Pros: They have great paninis and there are always free tables - but the best part is its chill environment, it's great to get work done :)

Cons: There is some scarcity of energy outlets, so you have to plan ahead when choosing a table!
author: Mariana F.

description:
So I really loved this cafe until today... It's Sooo the last straw for me. What happened to their customer service? The tall blonde guy seems to not like his position anymore or he has just been having a bad day these past few months. Today the half and half container was empty so I kindly was going to let him know and he just snapped and said "u can leave it over there and ill get u another one" ... Whoa!!! Both hands in the air "my bad" did it matter which side of the counter I was going to leave it at... Sheesh!!! Okay now!!! Sorry!!! 

Anywho but imma not be to hard because their salads and pastries are really good and the cafe seems to be clean, yet ??? I don't know why they leave those 2 crusty garbage cans right at the condiment bar hmmmm?? Gross .. but oh well they won't be seeing me no more so who cares... So sad to say cuz at one point I was a big supporter of this place "peace out" "two fingers up" "deuces" 

P.S.    F. Y. I "customer service does matter"
author: YennyMack L.

description: The best work spot in town...can't speak to their food, but the coffee and the wifi are both strong and consistent...and the atmosphere screams "today, I will get shit done."
author: Ada K.

description:
The coffee: They are brewing Bicycle Coffee,it is free-trade, locally roasted and delivered by bicycle. The roasts are flavorful and do wonders coarsely ground in a french press.

The atmosphere: Nice and clean, lots of seating. Very MacBooky, but you can make due. 

Cost: Average (on the lower side)

Try: Breakfast bagels

Overall: I stopped in during the first few weeks and had a so-so experience, but all of my recent visits have been on par. It's good to see hard working people bring a place like this into fruition. Show them some support and keep good business in the neighborhood.
author: Taylor S.

description:
PROS:

- They have a nice upstairs floor where you can work on your own stuff privately. The windows keep it nice and breezy, almost calming.
- Lots of ample electrical outlets for the mac user. Yes, everyone here uses macs! I looked up and realized everybody on the floor had the exact same laptop. It was pretty amusing.
- Good quality coffee
- Strong, fast wi-fi. I stayed for about six hours the last time I was there and didn't have any issue with the connection, and the baristas didn't have an issue with me for staying so long. 

CONS:

- If you're picky on customer service, you'll notice that the people here are a bit aloof. But then again, you're just ordering some coffee, not trying to make friends. It was fine for me.
- Music can get a bit.. strange here? The last time I was there I noticed they had some songs in from the Bling Ring soundtrack, like M.I.A and Sleigh Bells and "live fast die young bad girls do it well". Loud and raunchy songs though I have both on my playlist.

This is my go to place for their epic wi-fi and private seating. Everyone's doing their own thing here.
author: Jasmin K.

description: I chose this place at random because I was hungry and found a spot next door. I'm glad I did. The coffee was bomb and the sandwich was really good. They played some good music too. My first time here, I'll definitely come back.
author: Xavier T.

description:
Great place to work on laptop.

Pros:
 --- fast reliable wifi (I am a very demanding VPN user)
 --- plenty of tables w/ outlets (always check upstairs)
 --- clean bathroom
 --- good selection of drinks and pastries

Cons:

 None I can think of!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Really great study spot with open air! Lots of windows and light.  Extra outlets upstairs for when it gets crowded or noisy downstairs.  The crew who work here are pretty rad.  They all get along really well with each other and with the customers. 

Yummy paninis and coffee drinks.  Oh and the baked goods aren't bad either!
author: Ali B.

description:
This is my new favorite cafe to work from. The upstairs loft area is a great place to get some seclusion to focus on work, but there are still plenty of windows to let in light and fresh air. The walls of the loft area are also painted with artwork (see pictures).

The breakfast food is pretty standard (bagels and breakfast sandwiches) so there isn't much worth saying in a review since it's pretty difficult to mess up a toasted bagel with hummus; it was good!

The staff is friendly and the prices are decent too. Many other cafes charge close to $2.00 for a 12oz can of soda. A 20oz bottle of soda is $2.25 at Another Cafe, which for a cafe is a very good price.

The wireless internet is good. I got a download speed of 15Mb/sec and an upload speed of 8.8Mb/sec (via speedtest.net), which is great considering that I'm sharing the network with at least eight other computers. There are four power outlets for each of the tables in the loft area, very nice!
author: Andrew M.

description:
As far as local breakfast/lunch spots go this place will not let you down

Staff and owner are all rad people, good food options and coffee as well (baristas know what they are doing so no burnt cappuccinos lol)

The interior is a lot nicer than any other local spot, very modern and we'll kept

If you're looking for a place to kick back with some friends and grab a cup without a fast pace vibe of a chain restaurant this is the place to go

Happy yelping
author: Corbin B.

description:
Super fond memories of this place as they provided me with a warm cup of coffee and a dry place to sit in rain while I was house hunting in SF. 

Bicycle coffee is divine, so smoky, rich and prices are very reasonable. 

Sandwiches (especially breakfast) are soo good. They use this herbed egg that makes the whole thing so gourmet tasting.
author: Emily H.

description: Overall great cafe! Artsy walls, 2 floors of sitting, good coffee, EXCELLENT wifi. Not a fan of the hip-hop music though; makes me wana pop, lock and drop it when really I just want to open my laptop and do some work. The bass can also be a little over-bearing.
author: Kenneth N.

description:
Nice little place and a great place to study. 
I would have rated this place as  5 stars if the internet wasn't slow the last time I was here. 
Nice food and good coffee, though a bit pricy. Almost 9 bucks for a breakfast sandwich? 
Give it a try, maybe they'll improve internet in the future.
author: Juliana B.

description: Amazing atmosphere. I loved the wall of skate decks. Baristas were super friendly and made a killer vanilla soy latte. Free wifi, too. What can be better than that? I'm only in town for a week but will definitely be returning here for another coffee and a pastry (or two).
author: Liz M.

description:
Do yourself a favor and do not come to this place if you have work to do.
The place is so filled that you can't even get a table to sit down.

That was okay first since I thought that there's a reason for that: the high speed internet, the reason I literally traveled here to do my important work.

The free wi-fi sucks so hard that it didn't even load Yelp for me to write this review. Neither google.com. 

I had to use my iPad hotspot to write this review.

Seriously, if your café is chosen to be in the list of the best cafés for work in SF,  it should be so obvious to get a high speed internet and router good enough for as many connections as the place can hold. 

The reason I am giving one star is that they sell gluten-free cookies and the restroom was clean and big.
author: Patyo E.

description:
3 1/2* Another Café
Cute little café on Nob Hill
Bizarre wall décor
Nice place to stop for a rest and a snack
Free wifi
Coffee drinks are good as are the cookies
Friendly staff
author: Rosquete B.

description:
good for study or read a book. 
however this place is clouded every-time. 
hard to find a seat. 
great free wifi connection. 
when i went here, there were two kind steps. 
but, u need to pay $1.50 for house coffee refill whatever u ordered. (little bit expensive)
author: Junghee H.

description:
+2 stars for the delicious coffee and espresso and the fact that it's local and organic.
+1 star for the decent food selection, including great breakfast sandwiches
+1 star for the atmosphere - plenty of comfortable work space, free Wifi, and lots of power outlets

No star for the less than friendly staff. Maybe I'm not cool enough, but I just never quite feel super welcomed here, with the exception of one barrista who always has a smile on his face and is nice. The other staff members aren't all unfriendly per se, they just don't really smile that much and make me feel like I'm bothering them. But maybe that's me taking it too personally.
author: Jennifer M.

description: I walked in on a Saturday at breakfast time. Ordered a coffee and a ham cheese and egg croissant. The service was "cool" but not very friendly, coffee was quite good. But oh the croissant, it was way too greasy, eggs were overcooked and hard to chew, ham was clearly from a cheap package you can get from supermarket, and cheese was melted to a big slab of yellow thing. Overall I think I want to like the place, but the croissant made it difficult for me.
author: Wendy K.

description: I worked from this cafe yesterday and loved every minute. The space upstairs is well designed with lots of outlets, there is free wifi, the music is not too loud, coffee is good and staff are friendly!
author: Amy M.

description: Internet. Coffee. Above-average cafe food. Been here plenty of times - sometimes it's warm and welcoming...other times it's moody.  Really depends on the vibe....
author: Adam S.

description: This is just my cozy spot right next to my new place. Coffe is nice, people who work there are amazing. It's the place if you want to hangout with a friend or two, or just bring your laptop and have a quality alone time. Love!!
author: Jennt C.

description: I liked this place.  It was a relatively quiet place near St. Francis to get some reading done and enjoy a nice cup of coffee.  It was only a block away.  I only had a cup of Joe, but their food looked /smelled good too.  The prices were very reasonable, especially for being in the city.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Stopped by Friday morning for a quick pick me up.  $3.45 for a single latte - and it hit the spot. 

There's wifi and plenty of seating (stools alongside the windows, tables and high tables on the main floor and a handful of seats on a second level too).  Most folks there had a laptop out and looked like they'd been lounging for a while.  

Another Cafe serves bicycle coffee (aka organic, fair trade, deliciousness), bagels, breakfast sandwiches, and paninis.  All around, it seems simultaneously like a great place to hunker down for a couple hours and like the perfect stop for breakfast and caffeine on your way to work.
author: Kimya P.

description: Lack of basic customer service skills and basic manners. Walked into a nearly empty cafe 2 baristas that were not busy and no basic greeting or a thank you. Not impressed  guys you need to do better.
author: Carl L.

description: Good coffee, decent wifi, lots of seating. The upstairs area is nice for grabbing a table and working.
author: Amin S.

description:
I'm writing this review as I sit in the cafe. I love it.

Been sitting here for a while with a chai latte and the reuben sandwich. The chai latte was pretty good, a bit on the sweet side. Reuben sandwich was tasty and filling. I'm more a fan of the overall offering. The baristas were friendly, the ambiance is warm, the interior is well lit, the playlist is great (lots of throwback), people seem to be enjoying themselves, there are lots of outlets, and wifi is solid. I'll be living a brief walk from this place, so looking forward to being a regular!
author: Zeya Roy Y.

description:
When I arrived in San Francisco, I needed a study place to work in the afternoon. I found Another Café, and it rapidly became my favorite coffee shop. 
Coffee is excellent and they never run out of soy milk. They also serve amazing snacks and pastries, you should try their Almond Croissants !
The Free Wifi is highly reliable, and there are plugs available for each table, is it luxury?!
Lastly, the music is not too loud, and creates a friendly atmosphere.
author: Emilie A.

description:
Friendliest baristas ever! Free WIFI, clean interior, and a good spot to do some studying or reading.

Try their almond scone, and ask for it heated, perfect start to a morning.
author: Angela K.

description:
Oh man!  I'm not a regular Yelper.  In fact, I avoid writing negative reviews because I feel like it's a cowardly way of saying, you suck.  But after the experience I had today, and since I will never be back, I will have to settle with communicating my irritation via this online forum.  

Don't get me wrong, I LOVE the coffee here.  What I don't love is the absolutely RUDE bicycle hat guy that nearly refused to take my reused "starbucks" coffee cup and fill it with much needed coffee.  WHAT? It's earth day man! I'm trying to re-use a cup and you won't re-fill THIS cup because it happens to be a starbucks cup?  Ok so I talked him into it.....but he made note that he will not give me the refill discount.  DUH, I just want to buy a cup of coffee, and I want it in this reused coffee cup!  You on board?  

"Do you have more creamer, you ran out"...  I asked twice and not once did he look at me and acknowledge me.  You know--the first cup of coffee of the day should be an enjoyable experience.  Get a clue man and start treating your customers with some basic kindness and respect.
author: Stacylynn S.

description: I just absolutely love going here to do some work on a weekday or a weekday. It's pretty quiet, and they play some awesome music. Also, you can't go wrong with the upstairs seating as well. Love it.
author: Joanne W.

description: I live around the corner and I drop in here all the time, usually receives great customer service but today I received the worst service I have ever experienced. I was standing in front of the register and the young cashier was talking to her coworker for 5 minutes before assisting me. Not even a greet or any sort of acknowledgement received. It felt as though I was interrupting their conversation. She finally took my order and I didn't even get any type of thank you or connection. I was the one was being polite and even thanked her. -Thanked her for a terrible customer service.-
author: Jst S.

description:
This is my favorite place to go when staying in SF for morning coffee and bakery treat.

Outstanding courteous staff that really welcome and make sure you are only a stranger on your first visit!
author: Jim E.

description: Service is ok.  Mochas are pretty good.  Breakfast sandwiches are eh ok, not anything special.  I like that this place is close in my neighborhood.
author: Maile N.

description:
I generally get coffee here somewhere between three and five times a week. Staff is friendly, music is good, decor is modern and clean.

Another Cafe's Bicycle drip coffee is awesome. Various pastries are generally pretty good, particularly the bear claws and the apricot danish. Oh, and the croquet madame/monsieur is worth both the price and the wait.
author: Dave T.

description: Another Cafe is open til 10pm on weekdays (awesome!) and 9pm on weekends (also awesome). Also everyone is mostly doing work there so it's a great place if that is what you are trying to accomplish. Both the sandwiches I've tried have been surprisingly good (garlic chicken & turkey). This place has a good cafe feel and is really funky. Check out the pictures of the art on the wall!
author: Tara S.

description: Turkey cranberry panini is really great! Topping with cream cheese makes it fantastic:) Also, the place is comfortable, with good quality of wifi, and so on.
author: Elysion C.

description:
Great staff, good sandwiches.
The Bicycle coffee is okay, not my first choice though.
Customers can be a bit cold and jerky about sharing tables.
Putting your bag on the chair your not using is basically giving the middle finger to anyone looking for a seat.
Don't be a jerk, share the space.
People may think you have friends and your appeal will skyrocket.
author: Isley T.

description: This is my go-to work place when I'm working from home. Their upstairs loft is awesome for getting some quiet time to work - free wifi! The coffee is really good and so are their pastries. I had lunch there the other day with the man and he liked his Turkey panini more than I liked my mustard one, so get the Turkey one; I think it has pesto in it. ;) I also know they're applying for a liquor license... psyched for what that means.
author: Emily R.

description:
Nice little cafe with a pleasant, relaxed vibe and friendly people behind the counter.  The pastries are unexceptional, but the bagels are a bit better and the breakfast sandwich ($5.50, not the $9 someone else mentioned) is entirely serviceable.  My lattes have been tasty and delivered with a smile.  

I'm a tourist looking for a simple breakfast, but it is also popular among the coffee-to-go and sit-and-work crowds.

Nice people. Good coffee.
author: Ben W.

description:
Our neighborhood cafe, so easy to walk to and turn into a wifi-zombie given their free internet.  So sad.

On to the food -- what stands out the most for me is the Turkey Cranberry panini.  Gold.  Rueben is okay, but That Real Deli on Polk would be the right place to go for something like that.
author: Chris E.

description:
- Lots of seats. Plenty of outlets. The upstairs area is pretty cool. The traffic outside can be kind of loud though. Hip decor.
- Had a Reuben. Pretty tasty, would recommend.
- Large coffee is not served in a mug. Medium coffee is served in glass with a cardboard holder.
- Wifi is available. Can be slow sometimes depending on what everyone else is doing.
author: Ceasar B.

description: I walked here because of the reviews, and I have no idea how this place was rated so positive . Service is slow. They microwaved my breakfast sandwich, not actually cooked in a kitchen. Latte was average at best. Disappointing for the price.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Considering it's a block away from my apartment, I'm partial to Another Cafe. But if I lived across town I would still have to come out of my way to visit here.

The baristas are always so nice, the coffee is amazing and the sandwiches are so damn tasty. I LOVE bringing my laptop and chilling upstairs while I sip on my drink. It's just a great place to be and it's not snobby like other places I've been.

Definitely my favorite coffee joint in the city.
author: Tyler H.

description: If you get one thing, get the garlic chicken sandwich. In-cred-i-ble. Fast, free WiFi, plenty of chairs and tables, even standing-height tables, and an upstairs section with extra seating. Wait for food can get long if there's a line, as they make from scratch and make well: worth the wait.
author: Matt D.

description: Stopped in for coffee and bagels and was not disappointed. Good coffee, fresh bagels. The place is quiet and clean with fast, friendly service. Nice neighborhood coffee shop with a cool interior and some outside seating.
author: Reservation For 3.

description: Worst service ever. Grumpy attitudes. Burnt bagels with extra attitude. Juices are poured from a trader joes bottle. not the ideal way to start the morning.
author: Danny L.

description: Good studying space! Lots of outlets and good wifi.  Good reasonably priced drinks.  Beers on tap.  The upstairs is a good spot to get some work done although it's often full and can feel a little cramped.
author: Travis G.

description:
Cool place. They have neat upstairs seating with hip art lining the walls.

You'll always find people here studying, as it's very conducive for that type of environment. There's also a bit of outdoor seating should the day be nice enough to enjoy.

My only gripe comes from the blehness of the croque madame / croque monsieur. I think I was expecting more French cafe and delicious caliber food. I should have instead known better to expect generic American toppings shoved into a croissant.
author: Paul B.

description: Do something about the flies tho. One just landed/died in my beer (needless to say I won't be drinking said beer)
author: Cameron H.

description: This place used to be so good! Everything on their menu was made so well. The best part they were reasonably priced. But now, everything seems to have changed. They bumped up the prices to $2-$3 more, and the sandwiches are made so poorly. Less amount of ingredients, so not filling/satisfying anymore. Even their iced coffee tastes water down now, when it used to be so strong. Maybe they changed management? I don't know but it's just sad.
author: Ivana T.

description:
I walk past 4 other great coffee shops just to go to this one. It's my favorite. 
I'm needy. I go out for interaction and to make picky choices on the food that isn't even on the menu. They accommodate me. Best coffee and Lattes around. They use the best soy milk. 
I don't know why somebody is trippin about customer service cause that is one of the main reasons I go there.
author: Cobra S.

description:
This has become my regular local go-to cafe. The music is pretty good (sometimes) and the coffees/teas are tasty. I like the atmosphere and the people that work here- they are very friendly and helpful. 
I also like that there are two floor here. The first floor is more spacious and open, while the second one is darker, but 'homier' and secluded. Its a good place to get your work and/or homework done. Hey, you can probably even sit and write a book here :) 

I haven't tried their sandwiches or salads, but I hear they are good.

A couple of pointers to make this place even cooler: there is enough space to add 2-3 more tables upstairs (ex. one on the corner by the staircase). Also, it would be good to remove the dust off the staircase and other places dust settles in. 

Thank you for the lovely thinking/working/writing/socializing spot. :)

P.S. the internet is fast, which is a huge plus. I cannot tolerate a cafe that has slow internet. we are no longer in the XX century :)
author: Yuliya K.

description:
3.5

Because Nob Hill Masonic Center's food/beer was too expensive, we oped for Another Cafe. They ran out of baggles! So I had the turkey/cranberry/cream cheese panini, my food sharing partner made a disgusting face at the sound. But he finished every bite and we celebrated Thanksgiving early this year on our pallets. Check in on yelp and get a free bag of chips!
author: kim w.

description: Iced coffee for 2.50 which is a great price for the city. Also a plus it's from bicycle coffee which is becoming my favorite coffee brand.
author: Derrick W.

description: coffee is decent here, wifi is free, place is clean and people are friendly. It does take a little while to get a breakfast sandwitch but its hot and fresh so im a happy camper with this place.
author: Kristan B.

description:
My new favorite place to study. I love the music here and the staff is friendly.
They have great coffee and I also love the ice tea.

Close to home which is just perfect!
author: Linda E.

description: I live right next to this cafe and used to stop in occasionally for a coffee or a sandwich. I've stopped going here, however, after a cashier completely forgot my sandwich order and then sat at the tables outside on break. After waiting 45 minutes for my sandwich and seeing other people coming in after me getting their orders, I talked to the sandwich maker who seemed confused about my order. Apparently the cashier never gave him my order. I got no apologies and felt like the staff was treating me as if I was trying to get a free sandwich. Anyway, I'm sure I was just hangry, but the experience has led me to just boycott the place. Otherwise, the coffee and sandwiches there are good.
author: Paul G.

description: I study here occasionally. The coffee is really good and the food is pretty good too. I love the location (only a couple blocks from my apartment) and I like the upstairs space. I would study here more frequently, but it's a hipster hangout and hard to find a seat; they also play the music a little too loud sometimes.
author: Justin H.

description: Food is ok, Drinks are good. Internet is ok. Staff is terrible, very inattentive. I came here on both Monday and Tuesday to get some work done, stayed until 930 on both evenings. Both nights I had the IPA. I was charged completely different prices ($3 on Mon, $4.50 on Tues), for completely different size drinks (A pint glass on Monday, a small cup on Tuesday). I appreciate the ambiance, but a small amount of professionalism on the staffs part would bring this place up to 4-5 stars.
author: John C.

description: A pretty good haunt if you're an early-riser, they're thankfully open by 7 on weekends, and a cool place to blend into the woodwork with a laptop, etc. I'm a big fan of the bagels  here, but never been fond of the Bicycle Trade coffee they use; too bitter. This is the only place I need to put cream & sugar in my coffee. On the whole a solid place with friendly staff, plus they recently started taking credit cards which I appreciate. My only word of caution and perhaps they're only issue is that if you're not in there early, you'll be waiting a while for a sandwich, etc (:30 mins once).  There's a really cool looking upstairs seating area that I've never seen anyone use, I'm not sure if you're allowed to sit up there, does anyone know?
author: Jesse G.

description: Popped in for a morning coffee. Great quality black coffee--which is surprisingly hard to find sometimes. Not a sit down breakfast place, but if I was a local I'd hang out to enjoy the wall art and swan around on wifi.
author: Mari M.

description: Brought my own cup. Charged me $2.95 to fill it with coffee. Nice room. Good location for Nob Hill folks, but the price on a cup of coffee -- to go, own cup -- is outrageous. Consider knocking it down a buck for folks whose plan it isn't to sit around sucking seat space, 120V AC and 802.11.g all afternoon. Otherwise, I'm heading back to Peets. Counter service was very polite and gracious.
author: West R.

description:
This is the perfect cafe to come grab a (super delicious) chai tea, coffee and/or pastry and work. They have wifi, lots of pastry options, great music, and cool art. I'll definitely come more often to do work at this great cafe.

UPDATE:

Seriously, I love this cafe. I've been coming steadily now for a few weeks and it's always a great experience. They always have such great music playing. I love their upstairs (although I'm terrified to be there if the next big earthquake hits). It's a great place to study in the city.
author: Kate P.

description: I would agree with many posters on here.  The coffee is good and some of their food is actually decent.  However, their staff lacks very basic service skills. If you do not want to work a at a cafe, then don't.  I haven't been in here for about 8 months and I'm reminded why I stopped coming here.
author: Stan V.

description: Tons of outlets; great atmosphere for getting work done. Food's good, coffee's good, prices are good. Upstairs seating has extra cool vibes and you don't feel like you're in the way. Lalalalove it here.
author: Amy J.

description:
This is the best place ever. Light, airy, clean, with beautiful wooden bars, Bicycle dark roast coffee, colossal sandwiches you can split with a friend, and friendly service.

There's frequently a checkin deal that gets you a free drip coffee with your purchase of a bag of Bicycle beans.

Wifi is fast and reliable, and if you'd like some extra quiet, head upstairs to the loft-mezzanine for some interesting mural art and a bird's eye view of the people.

I love you Another Cafe. Almost enough to walk up a giant hill.
author: Megan G.

description:
My favorite place to get my morning coffee. The staff are friendly. The free wifi was a life saver when I locked myself out of my apartment, so I waited in the cafe and got some work done while my spare key was on the way. Perfect little cafe to live right next door to. 

Start serving beer and wine!
author: Erin L.

description: An amazing cafe! Lots of tables with a lot of plugs around the cafe. Music is great and helps me to focus. If you live in nob hill, then this is a cafe where you can work and get a lot done.
author: Charles Z.

description: I love this place, it's my office away from my home office. Friendly staff, great food (try the garlic chicken!), cheap drinks ($2.25 iced tea). They've also got a box of free 5x7 photos of local landmarks. What a neat idea! I got one of Lombard St but there's dozens of different shots.
author: Adam D.

description: Another Cafe,I think is a great place to have a wonderful cup of tea or coffee. My experience there are always pleasant. The evening staff behind the counter are so friendly and nice. They greet you as you come in the door . Let me point out greeting customers make a big difference in quality service. Another Cafe is a wonderful place to be. :)
author: Darnell H.

description:
Cafe full with people working laptops, with relative low noise level.
For me, it is a great place for work - I didn't have distractions, and sockets were available.
author: Piotr M.

description: Really cool atmosphere with nice music, plenty seating (for its size) and lively, friendly employees. The iced tea was delicious! Great place to sit and work or read while enjoying a drink, especially because there are outlets everywhere.
author: Marissa L.

description:
Neat little cafe I've accidentally run into a few times. If I lived in the area, I would probably not-accidentally visit it regularly.

Two floors, friendly staff, chill vibe, and the food is good. Don't think I've tried the coffee. Seems like a good spot to work, particularly with two levels. Don't think I've seen it overpacked.
author: Thuan N.

description: They open early on weekdays! This was perfect for me since I usually work on my personal project between 6-9am before work. Their coffee and food is good, and I've even enjoyed a nice IPA a few times when working later. As for the wifi ... it's free, which is good, but at times a bit unstable. From what I understand they might have upgraded their router now. All in all it's my favorite cafe to work out of in Nob Hill.
author: Marcus S.

description: Maybe, I just got unlucky but I don't see how this place got a 4 star average rating... The gal at the front was super slow taking orders. I asked if they brought the food out, since I had my pup with me, and she said it wasn't a problem. I waited for around 25 minutes outside for the tuna melt. I went inside to check on the status, and it was sitting on the counter. So, the tuna melt was kinda cold and actually really dry... It's hard to fail at tuna melts and food service was pretty bad, but the caramel latte was tasty and came out before I went outside so I upped the rating a bit.
author: Lainey D.

description: I came here twice during my trip in San Francisco and thought it was a nice little coffee shop. They serve beer which is a nice treat when I was waiting for a friend. I got coffee from them in the morning too, it was okay. The staff was nice and fast. They have free wifi which was helpful while working. It's a very popular place because there wasn't a lot of space available to sit.
author: Carmen R.

description: we used to love the coffee here but we stopped picking coffee at Another Cafe because the staff made us feel very uncomfortable about our race. Extremely poor service.
author: Deepa G.

description: Stumbled across this place after a doctor's appointment and was pleasantly surprised. I got a cranberry turkey panini and a chai latte--both were delicious.  They don't really seem to mention this, but the sandwich was made on this herbed bread that was just phenomenal. I'll definitely be back.
author: Kevin J.

description: Went in to grab a coffee during my break. The coffee itself was really weird tasting but the decor, staff and wifi were wonderful.
author: hannah l.

description: Great place! Staff, food and coffee (and beer!) are all solid. No complaints and I've been frequenting this place since it opened
author: Ashley W.

description: Seriously one of the best spots in the area for coffee and work. The staff is super nice and try to have fun during work. Plenty of seating. Plenty of outlets. Free WiFi.
author: Harry M.

description:
I'm writing this review from the spacious upstairs loft area of Another Cafe. There are plenty of outlets up here, free wifi, and lots of small tables that are great for freelancers like myself. In fact, this cafe is basically perfect for working, and I have gotten a lot done here in the past few months.

The coffee is only decent but it definitely gets the job done. The same goes for the food. It's not the best veggie panini I've ever had, but the reasonable price and consistent tastiness makes this place is my go-to space for all day working. The staff are friendly, the place is clean, the play lists are excellent, and sometimes I think the music is too loud, but then I feel like a a grumpy old man ("kids these days and their loud music...")
author: Lucy C.

description:
I've been coming to this neighborhood spot since it opened and it's only been getting better-The owner, along with the rest of the crew, are all super nice and know how to keep a solid Pandora playlist going. 

Also, props to Another Cafe for the newly placed compost and recycle bins! Since the opening of this cafe I've definitely seen the owner place a huge emphasis on eliminating waste by purchasing only compostable and recyclable supplies for his small business.

This place will be perfect when it finally receives its liquor license!
author: Morgan S.

description: Good service. Great atmosphere - very hipster. Great paninis. Will definitely be back. The house brewed iced tea is yummy.
author: Laurie A.

description:
Trying out fairly new coffee spot.
Haven't been here yet, so it's new 2 me :)
Located at Pine/Leavenworth.
Couldn't believe the primo parking space.
About 20-feet from the front...
In-between 2 drive-ways...
Enough of my musing...

Clean and spacious.
Barista-dude hammers out a decent drink.
Went for a double latte.

Better than average strength espresso 
Low bitterness/acidity
Good steamed milk

Only one block from one of my accounts.
With decent coffee, I'll stop back again.
author: Derek N.

description:
Brand new cafe one and a half blocks from my house. It's cute, modern, new and in a good spot for people watching.

 I got a carmel mocha and an everything bagel with cream cheese. I like that they serve the cream cheese on the side since most places put too much on for my taste. 

My bf got the tuna melt pannini and says , "its pretty bomb". So with that said I'm sure we will be coming back soon.
author: Ashton M.

description: The perfect neighborhood coffee shop. A Nob Hill techie spot with pretty decent coffee, great sandwiches and ample space (free wifi) to log in and rev up. Cool art and a very clean restroom. Friendly staff and better than average music on the speakers. If the coffee was a smidge better they'd get a 5 star from me. I recommend the Reuben or the Turkey on Focaccia.
author: Lee S.

description: Great little study spot with really yummy food!!! They are open late, which is what initially caught my eye! Definitely a go-to when in need of getting some work done after work hours or on the weekends.
author: Megan F.

description:
One word: AMAZING. 

I was in the neighborhood meeting an old friend and she had suggested to try this new cafe that recently opened nearby her work. I usually am hesitant when I go for lunch, especially since my office caters yummy food every day, but I decided ... why the heck not?

I ordered the tuna melt and a single size vanilla latte. Tuna melt: ummm, to die for! It was perfectly toasted and had just the right amount of cheese and tuna. I literally scarfed it down in 2.5 minutes. The latte you ask? THE BEST I'VE EVER HAD. It wasn't too sweet and had just the perfect temp. The froth even had a pretty little flower design. How disgustingly cute is that?!

Anyway, I give this place 5 stars. 1 because my friend suggested it, and anything she suggests is golden. 1 for the friendly staff. 1 for the tuna melt. 1 for the latte. And the last one because I'm happy, full and ready for nap. YAWWWWN.

Will def be coming back.
author: Rusty B.

description: This is a great little cafe with really good pastries, awesome espresso drinks, and friendly staff.  I was in town for under a week, but I ended up going to Another Cafe at least three times, passing at least ten other cafes on the way.  Their top floor is nice and quiet, and they have fast internet.  I highly recommend the health nut bars, which taste better than they sound, almost like a combination between a granola bar, an oatmeal cookie, and a shortbread cookie.  The lox and cream cheese bagel was also superb, with really light and fresh-tasting fish.
author: Nadine F.

description: Great place! Their sandwiches are so good and coffee is good. Good place to work, lots of people on their laptop at all times and they are open fairly late. The staff(especially)in the afternoon are very friendly.
author: Christine B.

description: Nice, really quiet coffee spot in Nob Hill.  The Bicycle Coffee there is good, and I ordered my staple nonfat latte, which was pretty delicious.  Seems like a nice place to get some work done.  I was there hanging out with a friend, but everyone else was studying/on their computer.  Will definitely take note of that.
author: Mel G.

description:
Stopped into the new-ish cafe as I was leaving town back to Monterey... stayed right up the street so I was determined to stop and grab something for my 2 hours drive (well 1.5 for me I drive faster than fast).  I parked somewhat illegally I think in the yellow loading zone... I was in and out in a minute or so and grabbed a quick orange juice... they don't squeeze it fresh in house but it sure tasted like it.  Not to sweet and with a hint of pulp and chilled to perfection.  It was exactly what I needed... something refreshing for my drive.  I was craving something salty and the owner (I'm guessing) mentioned he might carry chips... I think that would be a lovely idea.  If I had more time I would have stopped for a breakfast sando.  Everything is priced very well (super affordable) as my jugo was only $2.75... amazing!

My friend told me that the coffee was good too and is delivered via bike hence Bicycle Coffee... adorbs.
author: Shiho F.

description:
About a block away from St. Francis Memorial Hospital on Hyde.  I had coffee and scone, great little cafe with free wifi. I was there after 10:00 am, it was quiet, had great background music and friendly staff. 

Inside seating with small tables with chairs. Bar sitting facing Pine and/or Leavenworth Street. 

Yes, I will be back if in the area again.
author: Glo F.

description: I have to admit I only go here to study, so this review is based solely on that and I can't comment on the quality of the food or drinks. As far as cafes in the city to get work done this is one of my absolute favorites. Hard to go wrong with free wifi and plenty of tables and outlets. Most of the people I see in there are doing some sort of work too, so it helps to create a great environment for getting things done. The upstairs area is ideal for working because you are a little removed from the crowd and the noise level is a nice buzz. Bathroom is decent too... Always a plus
author: Victoria W.

description:
Just discovered this place.  Reasons for each star.

1.  Location.  This area needed a good coffee shop.
2.  It's a good coffee shop.  Clean and bright!
3.  Atmosphere.  Less of a hipster scene than Contraband. Good place to study.
4.  $.  Cheaper than other coffee shops around.
5.  Friendly, helpful staff.
author: Charles C.

description:
This is my favorite place to do work in Nob Hill. The space is big with lots of natural sunlight if you go during the day. You must try their bicycle coffee like everyone else says. Totally delicious!

The only downside was a couple times I went there the internet was slow. But it's not always the case, so hopefully you go on a day when it's fast.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Great place, inexpensive but delicious croissant sandwich, organic black tea, and a very relaxed vibe.  Wonderful oasis for a traveler to grab a table for a couple of hours without having to fight a crowd.
author: Jake C.

description:
Unexpected pairs.

First time: Turkey cranberry panini with cream cheese.

This time: Scrambled egg bagel with hummus.

Each pair brilliantly.

Americano paired with sugar free vanilla works as always. Here perhaps even better.

Love the space and staff as much as ever. This pair was completely expected.
author: Jason B.

description:
This place is perfect and to the point, which is exactly what the neighborhood needs. No longer do you need to head down to the TenderNob for a cafe or a good bite to eat, because Another Cafe is here. 

They have what you need: plenty of spots to sit, food and drink. They also offer Bicycle Coffee which is local and apparently good (I didn't have any, but that's what I hear). 

I did have the Veggie Panini and a bottle of water. Service was quick. The place is clean. The food was good. 

What more can you ask for?
author: carli m.

description:
I love the name. It's an Abbott and Costello skit for a new generation of San Francisco coffee shop dwellers. I also love the location--that is, central to a largely residential area between two neighborhoods. The mint tea I had was delicious, and a reasonable $2. The Pandora station piping in was varied and enjoyable. (Then again, I'm the type who can dig both James Taylor and Arcade Fire in a ten-minute span. It's not for everyone.) 

In sum: New and shiny and worthy of another star just as soon as it settles into itself. Mark my words. At present, it doesn't feel much like a comfortable hangout spot, because everything is perfectly clean and slightly generic-looking and there are no plush huge chairs to sit in, which is actually good because you'll probably get more done if you work in here. But it does need that certain "broken-in" feel that'll just come with time. 

Definitely check out the sweet art piece containing all the song titles. And maybe buy it for me.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
3.5 stars - Another Cafe is right in front of my usual bus stop and after getting off a flight and trekking back from the airport, I was hungry.  Their menu isn't inspiring.  It's basic coffee house food with a selection of paninis, baked goods, and pre-made salads.  I selected the tuna melt panini, expecting to be filled but not wowed,  I was surprised to see how large the sandwich was and even more surprised at how delicious a basic tuna melt could be.  The bread was flavored with rosemary and was both crispy and soft at the same time.  

The reason I'm not giving more stars is because I don't think this place is living up to its potential yet.  I know it's new so I will give it the benefit of a doubt, but I think they could have a few more menu items, like chips to go with the sandwiches, or maybe some sort of salad menu where they will freshly make and toss your salads.  Also, the place is clean but a bit sterile, I think some cozy seating or artwork could do the trick.  Staff is nice and the prices are good.  I haven't tried the coffee yet but Yelp tells me it's good, so I will definitely have to stop back in.  Overall, Another Cafe is a very welcome addition to the neighborhood and I hope to see more good things come from them.
author: Laura C.

description:
Nice little spot. Good coffee, clean decor and nice folks. Cash only, but the guy who runs it let me slide, being it was my first time in.

I'll be back for sure.
author: Frank S.

description:
Brand spankin' new cafe just opened downstairs in my building. This place is similar to Cup A Joe 2 blocks down, except newer with a more modern and contemporary feel. In fact, the owner and Joe are related. The furniture, the appliances, the food, the cups, the ATM machine, and even the cutlery seems to be the same (albeit new) as Cup A Joe.

The place is great. It's spotless and clean as it just opened. It's more upscale than Cup A Joe but less upscale than Contraband Coffee. The customers seem to be all local - a mix of Art Academy students, doctors from St. Francis, residents from Nob Hill, and passersby wanting to check out the new spot. I like the local and new vibe of this place. It's clean, modern, roomy, and spotless. It's much better than the liquor store that use to be here before. Overall, a great local business that you should check out.
author: Pat M.

description:
A very welcome sight on this corner that has been a bit depressing for the past few years. A place for those staring at a computer screen alone at home to bring a laptop and stare at in public.  I have been roasting my own coffee for the past 15 years and this cafe serves up a good solid roast - a handy backup for me. A nice touch with the seating outside (except 4-6pm weekdays, when Pine turns into a mini-freeway).  Toss in friendly and super-clean with a good welcoming feel to it. 

I hope the crowd here remains the neighborhood types and not the hipsters. Let them go to Contraband.

Overall, Bravo!
author: George S.

description: Nice cafe, nice atmosphere, kind staff, good place to work. Never tried the food, it looks good too though. Only dark side: the wifi is really slow. Sometimes okay, but when the place crowded you'd better have your 4G egg or just go back home. Please fix! I love this place otherwise!
author: Micha M.

description: Really chill vibe. Good music and a nice get away for lunch breaks. They have Bicycle Coffee and a nice variety of Panini's and Toasted Bagels. I will for sure be coming here often.
author: Fuad H.

description: love the contrast between aggressive booty shaking music and everything else they play. one day I came in and the baristas played the rhianna pandora station for like five hours. this must be the result of some musical compromise.
author: Niole N.

description:
Pros:
- Good connection WIFI
- OKAY Panini, could be better (Should take in some good points from Panini on that Haight spot.)
- Nice barista, not your typical SF duche coffee maker
- Lots of personal tables to work alone and not feel bothered

Cons:
- The barista chit chat could be alittle loud sometimes...
author: Jane B.

description: If you're looking for a coffee shop with a great vibe, look no further. What I love most about Another Cafe is its artsy atmosphere & the music. Things that I look for in a coffee shop: Free wifi, restrooms, and a plethora of seating+wall outlets. Another Cafe has it all. The coffee is decent and they serve a variety of sandwiches & pastries. The staff is welcoming & they do not seem to mind if you camp out there for a while.
author: Christina Q.

description:
Nice to have a coffee joint right on the block.  Havn't tried anything but the coffee but its strong, good and does the trick when im lazy and dont want to walk to bush.  

Free wifi, outdoor seating.
author: Brian K.

description: Don't expect excellent customer service (nor a smile for that matter) just great coffee.
author: Josué H.

description:
My wife lived 2 blocks from Another Cafe before we were married and I used to hit up Another Cafe every time I stayed at her place. The employees were always kind and the atmosphere was perfect. I would sometimes work for a few hours before then heading back to the East Bay. I would definitely recommend them for their coffee if you're ever in the area.

I almost forgot that my wife and I even tried some of their breakfast sandwich things. We used to get a bagel with nutella and cream cheese. We also really like their ham and cheese in a crescent, both were extremely good.
author: Jason B.

description: I tried this place a few weeks ago. I came to study which was a good place for that reason. They have a few beers on tap for a good price, and the food was perfect size for one person. I'm going to knock off one star because even though the place was clean there was a few flys flying around. One landed in my beer.
author: Hugo D.

description: I am seriously addicted to their sandwiches, especially the Turkey Panini. The staff is super friendly and play chill rap mixes with lots of Frank Ocean. Great place to work with lots of little tables and seating, although their internet gets shoddy when the place is packed. I would avoid coming here Sunday afternoons/evenings because it's always super packed during that time and it's more difficult to find seating and stable internet. Nice lattes too :)
author: Rinda K.

description: It's one of those hideaway places that makes you feel like a true San Franciscan when visiting.  I like the upstairs art work.  Great place to study too if you can find a seat in there attack-like upstairs section.
author: Jer M.

description:
Maybe it is because it is located near my house, but Another Cafe its my cafe of choice when I want to escape from my noisy and crowded apartment when it is  time to leave my three roommates behind and sink into the quiet atmosphere of a cafe.
The staff is friendly and always polite, and make sure to say something as soon as you walk in, even if they are already with someone. Whoever hires for this place knows their stuff - they did a great job.
With two stories of seating, you can either sit on the ground floor at a bench on a stool or in the more secluded upstairs portion. Be warned, the upstairs is the spot to be, and you may find it difficult to find a spot! But if you do, get ready for an excellent experience. The windows open up to the trees on the street and give off a great atmosphere that I find excellent to write and think in.
The coffee, a lot of people think this is the most important part of a cafe, but I am not too picky - maybe I just don't have a very refined palate. Either way, I only get one thing at Another Cafe and that is the triple americano. Always delicious, always strong.

All in all, if you are like me, you like some noise (the music is typically chill, ambient and tasteful), but enjoy solitude with company, Another Cafe will not let you down.

Plus they use Square! How cool.
author: Sean H.

description: Went in for breakfast sandwich & coffee. Sandwich good. Coffee had burnt taste. Brought this to preparer's attention. She was too busy to acknowledge me. So with that and cashier's disinterested attitude in taking my original order, I left the coffee & left.
author: Ron B.

description: Great spot to post up for a while and get some work done. Carrot juice, free WiFi and outlets - #winning
author: Ashley K.

description:
hurray for good coffee, fun and friendly staff and good tunes.

A massive deadline that needs coffee/motivation was helped by the fact that 'another cafe' served up decent coffee (i mean a latte that i could taste the coffee beans), the team were super friendly and there were plenty of seats in an open airy environment compelling me to crank through the workload I had in a short period of time. 

p.s. Lykke Li totally kept me going so thumbs up to that!
author: Vanessa T.

description:
I am a regular here and echo everyone's sentiments.  Good coffee, welcoming and studious environment, and great, comfortable space.  They serve Bicycle coffee and for the non coffee connoisseurs, such as myself, it's sufficient to get through a 3-4 hour long study session.  The sandwiches are pretty good too.

During the week, there are always enough seats and wall outlets for all to use.  Weekends are a little tougher to squeeze yourself in, but I often am able to make it work.  If there are no available tables, I can usually ask someone to share with no problem.  Love the upstairs area--it's neither too cold nor too hot and really conducive to being productive.  Wall outlets line all sides as well.  Internet connection can be spotty at times, and maybe it's just my laptop, but this is often a good thing for me...

All of the patrons are pretty chill too.  Not too many pretentious folks or hipsters here and no one obnoxious, save for your occasional girly, airhead gossipers who won't shut up when everyone else is clearly trying do work in peace.  No one cares about your asinine first-world problems.  (If you are that type of person, please gab outside or by the windows away from people who are working intently.  Observe your surroundings and have some common courtesy.)  For this reason, I hope Another does not introduce happy hour to the cafe.  Besides, cheap, good beer and a fun social spot is 2 blocks down at Cup a Joe's.

The only thing that isn't stellar here are the employees.  Don't get me wrong, they are nice and, overall, do their job satisfactorily, but really aren't that friendly.  Except for the taller short-haired/bald Latin guy, no one else smiles or really says 'thank you.'  It'd be a nice touch to an already fantastic cafe.  In any case, I can get plenty of work done here so I will continue to patronize the place, but wish the employees didn't act so miserable/blasé serving customers.
author: Dwigt K. S.

description: Some seats outside, some seats upstairs, cozy cafe to meet up with friends to chat, read a book, or work on your laptop. The service is friendly. The coffee and pastries are solid.
author: Dice K.

description: Love this place, perfect place for working, really nice and friendly staff! I always have latte with croissant
author: Niki N.

description:
I absolutely love this place! I come here and settle in with my hordes of schoolwork for the day-- and am greeted by a nicely lit atmosphere, friendly staff, a delicious Earl Grey Tea, and some of the most amazing paninis ever.

No, really. These paninis are on fluffy Rosemary ciabatta bread, have high quality cheese and meats, and also use tasty, flavorful greens. The sauce combinations are top notch, and each one is hand made on the spot. Also, they're huge! It's a real dinner (or lunch, since I'm a pig and eat a lot), even without any sides. I've had several occasions where I actually stop by just to grab a sandwich for dinner before I head on my way.

My favorite panini is the turkey cranberry.  Toasted, melty perfection!

Now if only they could have sides like fries or chips. I already talked to the owner about it-- they don't have an oven of any sort, so fries or baked goods are all an issue to make. I just hope they manage to figure that out eventually, because this place has a lot of potential. It's also quite fairly priced for a pathetically broke graduate student like myself.

P.S.: I don't know where they get their pastries from, but they're really delicious too!

P.P.S: Never mind! They take cards now! Best thing EVER!!
author: Joie F.

description:
I always forget my headphones, but I never mind when I'm here. Great music, atmosphere, art, large tables and plenty of outlets.

I'm always a fan of Bicycle Coffee, and I highly recommend the turkey cranberry sandwich.
author: Patty C.

description: My goto cafe in the neighborhood. I've been a regular for a few months. Great staff and vibe overall, especially if you're a chill person. Some people complain about the music in their. I like how it changes based on the tastes of each employee. Sometimes it's Alternative, hip-hop, electronica, latin, etc. I'm not that picky about music at all. I've actually discovered a couple new artists by going there. Just go, chill and get a little work done. If you want generic/forced customer service and a quiet environment, this isn't the best place for you.
author: Julian C.

description: Awesome artwork everywhere! Good food, nice people....plus they serve beer too! Good coffee also!
author: Peter P.

description: We are visiting from LA and thought we'd try this coffee shop to top off out fabulous SF vacation day.  We had tea, which was good.  However, the young man who waited on us was very personable and courteous.  That made the entire experience a 4 star night. Quite a different experience compared to the usual Sbux ordeal of being herded through the line.  The atmosphere was mellow.  If I lived in the area, I'd be a regular.  LA needs more places like this....
author: Tom D.

description: pastrami panini and white mocha are the must! Great fresh food and open space. Good space to chill, work  and study. Second floor is my favorite. Staff are nice and friendly but not the fastest service you get in SF.
author: A-B A.

description: I am really digging this place. I always look for a coffee shop with great food and coffee, as well as good vibe to study. this is like honestly one of the most perfect place i found that fits every criteria. i am going back all the time.
author: Christine K.

description:
I suppose I am spoiled by living in NYC and having a diner on every corner, but here in Nob Hill "Another Cafe" is an oasis in a residential desert.  Seriously in a town of this many yuppies I cant believe this neighborhood isn't saturated in diners and coffee shops.  

Location is +1, a great Cafe Mocha is +2 (they also have simple syrup by the bottle, which should be a staple at all coffee shops large and small but seemingly isnt, so kudos to you Another Cafe.) Clean store, friendly staff is a +1.  They obviously aren't baking their baked goods in some secret back store, and im not taking away a star for that.  But wherever they are getting their bagels from is awful, and I am sure they can choose a different supplier.  The everything bagel had twice the onion and zero garlic.  Blegh.  

Anyway long story short:  great coffee, meh baked goods.  But when you got o a coffee shoppe can you really expect otherwise?
author: Michael J.

description: Black and white mocha. Nuff' said - they make it perfectly!! The staff is beyond friendly and quick. They even let me bring in my little puppy while I wait for my morning go go juice! Winning!!
author: Donna H.

description: I ve been to this place a couple times during my stay in sf, good atmosphere to work and concentrate on your laptop, everyone is doing the same! Amazing paninis and bagels, good decoration, defo much better than starbucks!
author: Marc L.

description: I agree with all the positive reviews. I was visiting SF and definitely did not want to deal with the crowded tourist-oriented coffee shops around Powell Street. This cafe was completely worth the walk from Powell, as it has a great neighborhood vibe. I am really picky about my Soy cappuccino and I think the key is using the right soy milk. This place seems to have the right stuff. I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 because I really wish they had some kind of cereal/granola available for breakfast. However, overall I would highly recommend this place, especially if you need to get some work done. Wi-Fi worked flawlessly. The upstairs balcony area would also be a good place for semi-private conversation.
author: Faith H.

description: Great cafe. They accidentally forgot to make a sandwich I ordered. It wasn't a big deal and I went to remind them 10 min later. They actually refunded my money and gave me the sandwich for free. Super cool of them as I wasn't upset at all. They just decided to do it.
author: Teresa H.

description: Awesome place to hang out. I come here a few times per week, so often that the baristas know my order and my name on Square Wallet which is super convenient. It's like my morning home, and the upstairs is a great place to get some laptop time in. If I end up moving to another part of town having to find another another cafe is going to be tough, haha.
author: David K.

description: Excellent food!  I couldn't believe those sandwiches.  They aren't terribly expensive, but they take good pride in the food that they serve, and it shows.  If you want a quick snack, some good coffee, and a bit of quiet time, this is a good place to go with your laptop or book.  My fave place is to set up shop in the upper level.  There are far less distractions in this area of this little joint.
author: John G.

description:
It's a pretty good place to come study or get some work done.  Pretty laid back environment- not too many frills.  It's not too social, so I'm not distracted as easily.

One of the baristas working on Wednesday (I didn't get his name) was super friendly.  He took the time to chat while making the coffee.  Thanks for making it more personable and welcoming!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Agree with the rest of the reviews....great place to work and eat.  Don't see a problem with the service, it's just an order at the counter place.  Everyone was efficient and smiled, if not overly friendly.  I went solo to do some research, rest after a long bike ride, and eat lunch.  Caprese sandwich had fantastic crispy herb bread, fresh tomato, basil and tender mozzarella.  Perfect iced tea too.  Ended up staying longer due to the relaxing atmosphere, good (not too loud) music, and delicious pastries and coffee.
author: Therese D.

description:
When I'm not brewing coffee myself, I'm getting it here.  Most reliable and consistent strong cup of coffee in the area.  Friendly baristas, as well.  The pastries and other bites are tasty, as well.  

However, if you're in a hurry in the morning you may want to give this place a pass because sometimes there's a long line because there's only one person working. 

Overall, great cafe!
author: SP C.

description: It was ok, nothing special though. Veggie panini was good, but selection was a bit thin. Not impressed with the coffee, it was quite acidic, with a sour aftertaste. Might go back, but only if I'm already standing at their doorway.
author: Matthew W.

description: Definitely quite a good neighborhood cafe. Cute place, cool people, lots of space to hang out/study/relax, plus they use locally-sourced Bicycle Coffee
author: Rowena L.

description:
Cute little cafe a couple of blocks from my place. I've been coming here often because I haven't gotten Internet installed at home yet.

I've only gotten a small cup of coffee and chai latte, and both were fairly good and cheap. Haven't tried any of their food yet, but I would like to try their lox bagel. My boyfriend tried the garlic chicken panini and said it was pretty good.

There are plenty of seats and outlets for those that want to work remotely. I usually like going to the upstairs, where you will find smaller tables.
author: Aeramis F.

description: This place is a great neighborhood spot.  Coffee is pretty good and reasonably priced compared to other boutique coffee joints in SF.  The artwork in there is beyond amazing, I'd go there just to see what they have going on.  I actually wish that they'd switch out pieces sooner.
author: Casie M.

description: I have nothing incredibly interesting to add to the conversation except that I had coffee here twice during my last visit to SF. Enjoyed the coffee, baristas were nice enough and as an added bonus, they were shooting some Japanese commercial. I would be highly entertained to see if I made it in the background (seriously doubt it, but wouldn't it be amazing if I caught my big break in Japan?)
author: Renee E.

description: Garlic Chicken sandwich is bomb, and coffee hits the spot. My cashier was very nice, though service was slow. The line was out the door when I came and 20 minutes had passed before I was sitting down with my coffee. It was another 10 minutes before my sandwich came. I think they were a little understaffed, which is my only complaint. Other than that, great find in the Nob Hill area!
author: Lynne G.

description: This cafe is a great find in Nob Hill area. The garlic chicken panini is amazing. Cool artwork on the walls.
author: Stacey J.

description: Affordable, solid coffee drinks.   Staying open til 10 on the weeknights earns them an extra star. There is only so much that can be said about a cafe, but since Another Cafe does everything right.  I have to give them the five stars.
author: Floyd F.

description: Have been wanting to have a meal here for quite some time, as the menu looks delicious. Finally was able to stop by today, but had to leave, since every single table was occupied with laptops and single cups of coffee. I mistakenly thought this was a food establishment rather than free office space. Maybe if I ever get to actually have a meal here, I might change my review.
author: Frankie W.

description: Local Cafe, Fast and great place for your daily cup of coffee.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Delicious sandwiches and a really kind manager. But a couple of employees are grumpy and it shows in their lack of customer service. It's a great venue with two floors and fresh air. However because the place tries to be a trendy daytime club with blaring music (a mix of folk but unfortunately also wailing, screaming Bjork-style songs and bad techno), this is not a good place for socializing with friends.

PS A smile does wonders for yourself and the others who pay for food & service here. Please don't scream at the patrons who spend money and time here, thank you.
author: Sara M.

description: My daily vistis are graced by great coffee ( I mean that is why I go there on a daily basis) and super nice service from staff & managment ( that is why I mainly go there on a daily basis:)They have an upstairs area that is more quiet and perfect for getting some work done. Great art too!
author: Sophie H.

description: The spicy garlic chicken sandwich is great. Nice staff and a good place to study.
author: Jesper F.

description: Best coffee around, must stop anytime I'm visiting SF from Seattle, and Seattleites know good coffee.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I came here for the first time on labor day weekend. I needed to get much work done, and so needed to get out of the house.

It's between my gym and my house, so the location is great.

What is even better is the service. The baristas(?) are very friendly. Their coffee and food is also good, though not great. There were also open power outlets all three days I went. And they take Amex! I'll keep coming back.
author: Preston D.

description:
Another Cafe? I need to FIND "another cafe." ((Ha, get the irony?))

Ok, so I'm trying not to let the bad experience I had yesterday affect my review. If you're there for coffee, or even a coffee-bagel combo, it's an ok cafe. There's not a lot of seating and the upstairs (even though there's tables) apparently is barred from all human contact. The coffee is good, a little more expensive than Cup of Joe's (I think by like 10 or 20 cents, big whoop) BUT they take cards and cash which is more than I can say for Cup of Joe's (until they started accepting visas a week ago. Still. You snooze you lose.) 

HOWEVER (and that's a BIG however) I would NOT recommend going there to study. There are only two outlets in the entire building, and they are both on the same side of the wall, four feet from each other. This means that those annoying people that park themselves at cafes to study for 238432687 hours will all have gotten a table before you, and they all have no intention of moving. Also, the people there are relatively stand-offish- I understand if you're studying but a smile would be nice. There are 5 or 6 tables against the wall, and they were all taken by people at their computers for 2 and a half hours yesterday so I had to wait- yes, I'm serious- 2 and a half hours for a table. (Yes, I was that desperate that I would wait that long. The power in my house was out and I needed to do some work). When someone finally decided to leave I rushed over, snagged a table, when conveniently- my mom called me. I answered the phone and proceeded to talk to her for a few minutes (around 4 or 5, no more) and the woman next to me turns to me and says with an attitude that would put Kim Kardashian to shame- (AND I QUOTE!) " Excuse me, do you think you're going to be done talking on the phone soon?! I'm trying to do work over here and I'm blasting my music and I can STILL hear you talking. So can you stop?" 

I resisted the urge to shoot lasers out of my eyes at her and turn her computer into a smoldering pile of charcoal, and what I SHOULD have said was either: a) this isn't a library, b) if you want to talk about cafe ettiquette, are you planning on letting someone else use the computer outlet? Or are you going to continue to be selfish? But, I refrained. I ended up leaving and complaining to my mom instead. 

But, if anyone from Another Cafe is reading-

1) GET MORE OUTLETS PLEASE

2) Instead of separate tables have one LONG table around the outlet space, so people can actually plug in their computers 

3) There should be a time limit for how long someone can sit at a table (I'm not talking 15 minutes here, but at least reserve the right to make people move after 2 hours)

4) I love your coffee 

and 

5) Mean blonde lady, if you're reading this, just know that you're RUDE. (Wow, that felt good). 


For me? I'm off to find somewhere with more outlets and use my laser beam super powers for good.
author: Stephannie M.

description: Located just down the street from my house. Great coffee, great panini's, and great breakfast sandwiches. Decor is cool and the clientele seems pretty much what you'd expect for Nob Hill. Also, free wifi - Minus 1 star for some of the staff. Matt and the owner are very nice, the others, not so much.
author: Kent C.

description: I am so happy a cafe has opened in my 'hood and even better that it is truly a fantastic place. The coffee is legit - way better than the next nearest places in the neighborhood. I love the breakfast sandwiches too. Most of all, I love the friendly service and vibe here. It is a very spacious, welcoming spot, with great music, and there are plenty of tables for studying/hanging that aren't on top of each other like most cafes.
author: Lauren B.

description: I don't give 5-stars often but this place earned it. They served me the best macaroon I ever tasted. The chamomile tea was also very good. There is a good selection of juices, teas, muffins and snacks. The customer service--attentive and courteous. They played good reggae music when I was there. There is free wifi, plenty of seating, noise level was low (comfortable), I heard mostly music @ 9:30pm on a weekday, plenty of electrical outlets and a nice atmosphere make this a good place to do some work or just sit and relax.
author: Hugh M.

description:
My favorite place in SF!
I was looking for a right place to work, chill and drink coffee at the same time.
Paninis are great! Order Garlic Chicken Panini. But the portion is huge so you'd better ask for wrap the half of panini.
It has enough desks for people with laptops and staffs are sooooo friendly:)
author: Sara I.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood so have been trying different coffee shops in the area and really like this place- coffee prices are great, people are nice and the garlic chicken pita panini (with hot sauce) is awesome. Will definitely be back often!
author: Sarah W.

description: I had one of the most productive 3 hour periods of my life in this cafe. The music is great but not too loud -- perfect for studying. The iced tea was also excellent, though they should offer larger sizes of it on the menu. My drink also had a lot of ice in it. It wasn't that crowded on Sunday afternoon, meaning you should be able to snag a spot, but the place is rather small so you may be out of luck occasionally. Definitely would recommend as a relatively quiet area with flat surfaces and seating.
author: Julian B.

description: Great cofffee and ice tea. The service is very good and friendly. Only thing is the Music. Too loud and non-working friendly. I am not sure why loud club music in a coffee shop. Could be really annoying when you work. But, I think it help the staff which I can understand.
author: Shea Z.

description: Great cafe with free wifi. Upstairs tables great for working, and big open downstairs with tables and benches. Free wifi. Laid back vibe and killer background music. At the top of the hill, too, so it almost feels like everyone who got there already accomplished something.
author: Derek S.

description: Great place to study with a great selection of drinks and food. Very quiet. Free wifi. Some 2-hour parking around on weekends within 2 blocks of cafe.
author: Sonia S.

description: The Mission certainly has its share of haute java stops, but they usually come with a side of hipster superiority that I'd gladly do without. Another Cafe rivals its competitors to the south on quality coffee but does it without the pretension. Friendly staff, affordable prices and they brew a mean cup of coffee to boot. Free WiFi is a nice bonus. Big Fan!
author: Alex H.

description: Not too good in here. The cashier is so mean. People do not go here you wasting you money.
author: Athea C.

description: Great place to have coffee! Plus, the staff is amazing.. :)
author: Ella B.

description: Great ambience. High ceilings and lot of light. Great for working.
author: Christopher K.

description: The Garlic Chicken Pita Sandwich is killer, and make sure you get it with hot sauce!!!
author: Aaron B.

description: Clean, chill, generally pretty quiet and just a great place to sit with a good book and/or your laptop. They have delicious, reasonably priced coffee (I always get a vanilla latte), excellent foam (this is important to me; from the ages of 3 to 13 I could often be seen stealthily scooping the frothy goodness off the top of my parents' cappuccinos), friendly baristas and the patrons are always nice and respectful (i.e., not really noisy or reeking of cigarettes). They also have good lox and yummy bagels, which they butter for you. This may seem like an insignificant detail but it's really nice, none of those stupid plastic knives that bend or cold butter packets that don't melt and get all over your hands. Apparently this is a serious issue for me. Anyway, this place is great. It's not just another cafe. See what I did there?
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Yelp decided to "filter" my last review because I guess they thought it might be shady, but my name is Laura and this is really my Yelp account and I am in no way related to anyone at this business. I hardly ever post reviews on Yelp, but I was soo excited that this place moved in to my neighborhood I wanted to give them a good review! Please dont remove it this time Yelp! 

"Another Cafe? YES PLEASE!

I live on the other side of nobhill, but will gladly trek over the mountain for this place! The Illy cafe inside of the Fairmont hotel is the closest cafe to my aparment, but they charge an arm and a leg for a tinnie tiny coffee - that doesnt really taste that great... Contraband Coffee on Larkin St. was a newer discovery for me and my dog on our daily walks, but the people there (customers and workers) are snobby, the coffee is very bitter and their food case has no back door allowing flies (eww!) to run all over their food. I actually had a discussion today with a customer of Another Cafe about how much we dislike Contraband.

Another Cafe will definitly be my new stopping ground. Their latte's are so smooth you dont need any sugar - yay  - and the turkey sandwich I got today was very good. As I was leaving the nice lady behind the counter told me I had to try her homemade hummus and handed me a small slice of bagel loaded up with it. OMG - it was soo good! I'm really looking forward to coming back for more!  Great addition to the neighborhood :)"
author: Laura C.
