description: Good music good people good food and espresso. Work here a lot.
author: L L.

description: I was looking for a cafe that I can sit down for an afternoon and be productive. Another cafe is perfect for my need. I sat on the second floor area that overlooks the first floor. It's quite and there are plenty of sockets on the wall. Many people sitting there were working on their laptops too. In addition to the good coffee, I also enjoyed the art works on the wall. Like the atmosphere in the place and will visit again!
author: Cuting H.

description: would be 4 stars but taking off a star for the prices. definitely the highest prices around.  if you get a bagel with lox, cream cheese it's $7.50.  if you want tomatoes, cucumbers, capers or onions you have to pay another $.50 per item.  Chamelion cafe, the bagelry, etc charge $7 for everything included. You'll end up paying $10 after tax @ Another Cafe though.  need to get their prices back down to earth.
author: Barry Z.

description: Great place to go to for coffees small sandwiches or just a place to study
author: K D.

description: Love this cafe! Great coffee and snacks. Only giving it 3 stars because the music is usually incredibly loud, especially in the evenings.
author: Lindsay U.

description:
Pluses--clean, fast friendly service, plenty of space.
Minuses--too sterile, not homey, no soft seating, no vegan cookies, donuts, or pastries or plans to offer them, soy latte somewhat on the bitter side.
author: Bob G.

description: I love this place to bits! Wonderful staff, great coffee (and bagels!), lots of seating and power outlets, good music... what more can you ask for in a cafe?
author: Ciaee C.

description: Great place; marvelous food and staff.  I give Another Cafe my HIGHEST recommendations.  Always satisfied.
author: Jill J.

description: One star goes to the awesome bicycle coffee and the other goes to the great bagel and doughnut selection. Unfortunately that's where the good vibes end at "Another Cafe." This place definitely could be something more special, a little hidden SF gem perhaps, if it weren't for the pretentious staff behind the counter. In the mornings there is always this asshole ginger guy who seems to hate life and everyone who comes into the shop. Even if you are as friendly as can be, place your order and say thank you, he doesn't flinch. It's as if you are his mortal enemy and he would like nothing more than to see you burn in hell. Same with girl wearing glasses, no emotion, no friendly customer service, just dead eyes and a dead expression and she's ugly to boot. Whoever owns this store should really consider cleaning house before this place really does become just "another cafe."
author: Adam L.

description:
This is, literally, just another cafe in Nob Hill. But that's not so shabby; not so shabby at all. 

They carry Bicycle Coffee, which is both local and organic, i.e. pretty neat. 

It feels new, both in the sense that it still seems somewhat haphazardly put together, but conversely has the benefit of having friendly baristas and a clean space. 

Aaaaand they offer good pastries, a clever ha-ha name, and a decent dosis of Feist crooning in the background.

It's a decent, less intense(ly hipster), and cheaper alternative to Contraband, especially in an area of the neighborhood that is scarce in cafes.   

Definitely a valuable, though not exactly groundbreaking, addition to the coffee scene in these parts!
author: G. J.

description: Yummy bagels and great coffee. Come here every weekend.
author: Emily H.

description: The place is great and packed with art. Staff is very friendly. I would have put 5 stars ...if it wasn't for the sloooooooow wifi.
author: Baptiste P.

description: Pretty cool cafe, the staff are really friendly and nice.  The coffee is always good and they have simple breakfast sandwiches, not too greasy with a good portion of sand which meat in it.
author: Keri K.

description: Got a nutella bagel and latte, and couldn't be happier! Adding this place to my list of good coffee shops. It's always a relief to find a place where the baristas really know what they're doing.
author: Brittany F.

description: As other reviewers have said, the upstairs area is great for getting some work done. The wifi is sometimes a little finicky but not too bad overall. I usually get the chai latte or iced tea. The chai isn't anything special, but the iced tea is really good! The garlic chicken pita is also really delicious! I always get it when I'm there. It's $9, but big enough for at least 1.5 meals.
author: Judy H.

description:
I'm fussy about my coffee, like strong, dark, tasty coffee, hate Starbucks, hate places that put the coffee in the push top storage thermoses.  Another Cafe serves fresh hot strong, dark, tasty cofee.  

like!
author: rob h.

description:
A welcome addition to the 'hood. It's a new coffee shop that also sells the usual breakfast items (pastries, breakfast sandos), Bicycle Coffee, and sandwiches at lunch.
The owner is a real nice guy who is super friendly. He has done a nice job building this spot out from the old run down liquor store it used to be. Everything is clean, ample sitting space with tables (even a cool looking second level balcony that it looks like you can lounge in) and new. 
So how's the coffee? I was pleasantly surprised. It is smooth, silky, and did not have a bitter after taste, which the owner and I both agreed sucks in coffee. I also ordered a breakfast sando (scrambled eggs and ham with a slice of American between two English muffins) that they heated up on the panini press. It was tasty, and not greasy at all. Also, I like how they have actual hot breakfast items - so many coffee places only offer junk food (donuts and pastries), so it's great to have a broader choice.
I think he's got the right combo with his lineup and I hope he does well. I am sure I will be a regular as it is very convenient for me to stop in on my way to work. I'm a fan!
author: Matt H.

description: Exactly what the neighborhood needed. Love that they have wifi AND they open supper early!
author: Kajal P.

description: Bicycle coffee is watery.  Foam is not the right temperature.  Service is good and the place is well appointed.  I can't wait for it to grow and take on a more lounge feel with less symmetry and maybe some cushy chairs.
author: D B.

description: I usually go there on weekends or when I have to study. it's a great place where you can grab your coffee and fresh pastry, while taking advantage of their wifi.
author: Yass N.

description:
Great place/interior, location convenient, nice people, great artwork, food edible, coffee really could use help. 

I was incredibly eager for this place to open as I had highly anticipate what would take over the space but didn't want to get my hopes up too high.

Ice latte is your best bet but that's difficult to screw up.

Croissant stale first day they opened.

Drip coffee: seems like they got their water to grounds ratio a bit off. It was pretty bitter.

Latte: espresso didn't seem bad but the milk was not properly steamed and that's the most important part. 

I truly hope that they get a coffee trainer in there to teach the owners and Batista's how to properly craft great coffee. If they start making superb coffee I guarantee they will make some real money as a business. Even for the non-coffee snob, everyone notices a deliciously crafted coffee. 

Coffee's most important and then if they can find some great pastries it may be worth while.
author: Samantha S.

description: Delicious and amazing nonetheless, a great new spot to try with friends. warm welcome and clean, good atmosphere. the pastries and coffee were great and i would recommend anyone to try it!!!
author: Mariam T.

description: Finally! A cafe located close to me. Actually, it's in my bldg. The cafe is literally brand new inside. It is very clean, quaint and contemporary. The owner is very polite and professional. The menu sticks to the basics which  I like. The biggest plus is HOT breakfast sandwiches. Not many cafe's do this. Outside seating and free wi-fi to boot. Another Cafe did it right folks! Go check them out.
author: Michael R.

description: This place is perfect for sitting down and getting work done. Each table has access to an outlet. The upstairs loft makes this place unique and gives it that wow factor. Downstairs is more open space but the loft has a very private, intimate feel. The food and drinks are good and at a reasonable price. The people who work here make you feel at home. Never had problems with the WiFi.
author: Denise B.

description: This is the best cafe on Nob Hill.  Great space, very personable staff, delightful ambience and crisp wi-fi.  I wish I lived closer.
author: Captain J.

description: One of the best Cafe's in the neighborhood. Cool service, good coffee, and great food/pastry choices. The interior has a great feeling, very modern, urban, and minimalist. A great space for creatives to work, and enjoy the great music played by the staff. I visit this cafe very frequently and I'm never disappointed.
author: Anthony G.

description:
- Good coffee
- Nice atmosphere
- Free wifi
- good snacks
- Owner makes much better coffee than employees
- Some employees are a bit too hipsteri-ish
author: Nick S.

description: I was driving to work on more and was in desperate need of some coffee. After driving by this place for the past few months, I was tempted to stop by and try it out. Luckily, I found a parking spot right outside. I ordered a Cafe latte and OMG it was amazing. I now find myself craving their lattes every morning and stopping by before work. The sandwiches are very good as well on busy mornings I get one to go and enjoy it during lunch!  That staff is very friendly!
author: Anna B.

description: They have bicycle coffee!  Also, a nice variety of reasonably priced panini's for a quick lunch.  Low key atmosphere inside and plenty of seating to sit and read for a while.  Glad that they moved into this space.
author: C R.

description: I like their coffee and maple walnut scone. This place is warm and comfortable, especially on the 2nd floor.
author: Mina N.

description: This place is over rated. They kiss the locals butt and treat outsiders like they are not even there. My coffee was sitting on the counter for a while and the guy didn't even let me know it was mine. I had to ask. Then the locals come in the store and they are served directly to their tables and even get them extra goodies behind the owners back I'm guessing. The place is full of flies all over the place. I got the egg, ham and cheese and couldn't eat the egg. It has some stuff in it that tasted horrible. They should let you know on the menu or just tell you that it's not the usual bagel you are going to get.  It's no place to study or work like many reviews stated. a  lot off people treat this place like their office and are lid on their phones,  and some others think it's a dog park.
author: Z M.

description:
Great place to grab a coffee and get some work done!  I was looking for a coffee shop on a Sunday where I could catch up on some work and this place suited me perfectly.

Service was fantastic, coffee was ok, ambiance was very relaxed.
author: Gearoid O.

description:
My french press broke (again), so I stopped in here before work. $1.75 for a small cup of pretty good coffee. The shop feels a little sparse, but I'm sure it will pick up once word gets out about this place. They had some interesting breakfast sandwiches and juices out, but I have yet to try them.

Contrary to this yelp entry, they did not accept credit cards this morning. However, they will be accepting them shortly.
author: B Y.

description: Was staying with a friend, so frequented this place often. Some of the staff was very friendly, remembered my name and everything. I don't drink coffee, but my friend believed it was pricey. The sandwiches were good and so was the iced tea. Love the decor on the top floor. The wifi isn't always reliable, but the particular staff with the bald head was so friendly so they get a 4.
author: Olivia M.

description: Great, friendly staff. Elias runs the place and is always helpful. The panini are amazing, I personally recommend the Caprese. They brew bicycle coffee, which is incredibly smooth and tasty at all hours of the day. Plus, Another Cafe is open late, has a great atmosphere and is a good place to meet up or study. Highly recommend!
author: Nick S.

description: This cafe is an awesome place to hang out and get work done. They play really great music at a non-disturbing volume, have free and fast WiFi, really friendly staff, and great drinks and food. There are plenty of outlets all over the cafe to charge up, two levels of seating, and lots of natural light during the day. Highly recommended to anyone who wants to get work done, have a casual business meeting, or a nice lunch with a friend.
author: Ari S.

description: This place is great. Tasty lattes and pastries. Good selection of teas. Delicious grilled cheese sandwich. Very friendly and easy-going staff. Free WiFi. Nice interior. All good things.
author: Sarah D.

description: Great coffee and sandwiches, cheap prices, friendly staff, free wi-fi, and a clean, well-decorated space.  What more can you ask for from a neighbourhood coffee shop?  They'll definitely be seeing a lot more of me...
author: Yasir S.

description: Excellent latte! One of the best I've ever head. Amazing service and always very friendly! Gret neighborhood spot!
author: Lisa K.

description: Had to try this new cafe across from my work. The decor is pretty neat. Not much on the menu since they are new but nonetheless the garlic panini that I got was pretty good. And oh yea FREE WIFI.just had to throw that out there.
author: Joel A.

description: I live just a block away and would say I'm a regular here. I don't love the coffee by any means. I think there is way better coffee in the area.  Don't get my wrong, the coffee is good, just on SF standards, it isn't the best. I come here because it's such a bad ass place. It's cozy, light, and relaxing. The staff are chill, not over the top, and always make me a new breakfast sandwich without the meat.. so thats cool.
author: Lauren N.

description: This is my go-to cafe to get some work done when I'm not at 360 downtown. The staff is really friendly, the bagels/snacks are tasty, and the chai is a tad too sweet but delicious. Wifi is very reliable, the atmosphere is chill/peaceful/slightly energetic, and the settling is stylish with big, open windows.
author: F S.

description: Great neighborhood cafe! I came here intent on reading a new book for a few hours, and in that span of time, I got a cappucino, a turkey cranberry panini, and then sheepishly went back for yet more food - tea and an oat shortcake. Reduced to gluttony, but happily. The paninis are amazing! The bread is herbed and perfectly crisp. The oat shortcake was recommended to me by the guy behind the counter with a glimmer in his eye as I asked for the "best pastry." It did not disappoint, but it was so rich that I had to save more than half for later - then I got my butt to the gym afterwards :) Worth it! Great staff!
author: Amy W.

description: I go here 4-5 times a week. There are plenty other places in the neighborhood to go, and I always come here. The coffee isn't the best in town, but the place has a good vibe. The music is all over the map -- rap to 70s rock to bach -- but it's never too loud. Very little changeover in the staff. The same folks since I started coming here -- a friendly bunch. If you live in Snob Hill or the Tenderloin, this place can be a nice home away from home.
author: Lynn B.

description:
It is clean and bright and the people there are very friendly.   That already gives them a few stars.  And on top of that the coffee is good and I have had a sandwich that I enjoyed so their products are worthy also.  Because I live so close I have run in for coffee in the morning when we realized we were out and have not been disappointed with what we got.  I have also brought my laptop in a couple times to do some work and the wireless worked great and it was a good place to get a quick bit of work done.

Coffee snobbery can run deep in San Francisco and I tend to agree with some of it and only go to a handful of places in the city but I am happy to go to Another Cafe along with my other favorites.  Good coffee, friendly staff, nice atmosphere.   A very welcome addition to our neighborhood.
author: James S.

description: I was so happy to see a coffee shop open in the neighborhood and even more happy to see they serve Bicycle Coffee. Very friendly and cozy. I'll be a frequent flyer!
author: Liv S.

description:
How great it is to have a clean and spacious coffee house, run by nice people in a place on Nob that isn't overrun by street people and art students. Not that I have anything against either but, geez, sometimes you just want to not be near them, ya know?

So, the cafe doesn't have a deep menu, but what they have is well made and satisfying. The prices are on par with other cafes, it has free wi-fi and you see your neighbors. It's a great addition to Nob Hill!
author: Cherie D.

description:
Great place if you have to get some work done - its clean, very well-coming and good food!! I live a few blocks up and was looking for a place where u can just plug in your laptop, order some food and work on your book for a few hours - thats the place - loving it ... !! 

I give this place 5 stars coz i really love it - although the coffee could be a bit stronger soo...
author: Johana S.

description: I am so glad a good cafe has gone in here- it is about time this neighborhood had a good cafe!!!!  From opening day I have had good coffee, lattes, and various other items and I have been pleased with everything I ordered.  Also, the atmosphere is clean, has good natural light from the big window and the people working there seem nice.
author: J B.

description: Nice vibe! Good coffee and delicious paninis. Really nice art on the wall as well.
author: Joy B.

description: Friendly staff, really cool ambiance (beautiful artwork!), wifi and outlets and delicious coffee!  great place to get some work done, chill with friends or with a book!
author: Iva D.

description: I love this place. The employees are really friendly, and my coffee is great. It's really convenient that they use Square and I don't need to worry about not having cash (edges them out over Cup-A-Joe down the street). They have tabels & chairs in a loft space upstairs that I really like. I definitely recommend coming here if you need to study or work.
author: Brittany M.

description: Great coffee, personable customer service, and pretty good cafe pastries/food. Also, they even play pretty cool music as well. I recommend going upstairs to study and I prefer the morning/afternoon staff to the evening as well. However, don't get me wrong, everything about this place is wonderful.
author: Darrel H.

description: Great location, excellent energy and the food and coffee can't be beat. You have to try the white mocha and and the garlic chicken sandwich, both are delicious. I plan to come back soon.
author: Michelle S.

description: I've been looking/hoping for a cafe to pop up in this area for awhile.  The Gods have heard my cries and Another Cafe is the answer!  Great atmosphere, great coffee, nice selection of pastries, sandwiches, etc.  The space used to be a shady looking mini-mart.  Now, these guys have cleaned up real nice and it's a great place to stop in for a cup of coffee to go or chill for a bit.  Oh, and outside seating.  Done!
author: Fhadsljkaldsjh E.

description: Great new Cafe!  Staff is very friendly and the artwork is really trendy.  Plus the coffee is pretty good too.
author: Matthew W.

description: great cafe to get work done. delicious espresso, strong wifi, mellow atmosphere. got a sweet balcony and art and music. open late enough to finish up all the work.
author: J G.
